32792826.review:
[h1]-- Table of Content --[/h1]
[olist]
[*] Introduction, Disclaimer
[*] General
[*] Character
[*] Gameplay
[*] Graphics
[*] Soundtrack
[/olist]

[b]-- Introduction, Disclaimer --[/b]

Now then, my time to review this Secrets of Grindea. I tried to remain spoiler free, but you know...

Also note that the review regards Frontline, not stable. Also it regards Stoy mode, not Arcade - Don't like that arcade stuff that much. Never did. I will maybe update the review at some point to incorporate Arcade too. 

Early Access disclaimer: When I buy an EA-Title, I buy what is there. Not nececarily what is to come. Also, as EA-Customer I view myself, and all other buyers, as Quality Management. We get something that is still not finished. Which means we have the possibility of giving input and also we work as quality control. It is to be expected that game crashing bugs arise. It is to be expected, that balancing will be off at some points. It has to be clear, that it is not a finished product. Which means I disregard issues of this kind, as something normal. Not something to bitch about, as long as the issues are dealt with.

I used to work for a software company, so I do have a bit of insight on how the business works and more importantly, how long it can take to get stuff done. The devs here do have a nice level of communication with the community and most importantly: The SoG Devs are honest with what to expect from them. It's a team of 3 people and the level of care for each new implementation is big. I play Frontline, which means I expect crashes, broken Savestates etc. in exchange I get to play new content sooner. Still, I had yesterday my first crash with the game and never did I have a broken Savestate. I have seen "finished" games that did not perform as well as SoG. That level of care takes time. Which means. If you expect big updates on a regular basis, then you should not buy this game yet.

When I've first seen this game, it instantly reminded me of a mashup of Legend of Zelda and Secret of Mana. Which is and was exactly what I am looking for, since SoM is one of my all time favourites. So, after a few hours of reading through forums and the devblog I decided to buy the game. And I don't regret it. The game I have right now has given me plenty of fun time, enough to say this: I wouldn't be mad if they leave the project. I still have a game that is fun to play as is. But I am excited about every new content in Story Mode. 


[b]- General -[/b]

Bad things first. As of this moment there is only one thing I really dislike about Secrets of Grindea: No local Co-op and no direct plans for implementing one. I really hoped it would have a SoM like local co-op implementation and still hope it will get one. This is a game for the couch with friends. Period. I've found a dev comment within the forums that this topic is not entirely off the table, but also it's not sure to come. So that is the one big minus from me for the following reason: 

When this game will be finished, I will probably have already played it through 10+ times (I have finished my 4th playthrough already.) since I replay the whole game with every new major update (i. e. when there's a new region to explore.) to systematically look for bugs. As said I view myself as QC.

Starting the game for the first time, the game didn't feel like an alpha or early access in general. The parts done seem to be done. The graphics are nice and feel exactly right. With little use of placeholders. If placeholders are used, they too fit well enough to be regarded as satisfactory. Which gets me to the second "bad thing" - which I personally do not regard as bad, but others do, soooo... the time between major updates is rather long which makes the game progress rather slow. 

Personally I think this is a good thing. If you watch the Devblog, you'll get information on what work they do right now and how they progress. It's in not on hiatus, but the devs take the time they need to finish the game as they want it to be. I'd hate a rushed process, just because of *bleep* retards that have nothing else to do as to bitch around. Those kind of people will be the first to bitch if the game is rushed and not polished enough. So yeah, I don't care how much time it takes, as long as I see that there's work done and progress made. 


[b]- Character -[/b]

As we start the game we have the possibility of character customization. Meaning that we can choose our name, sex, hairdo, hair color and the color of our clothing. In general, we have a solid, not too fancy character customization.

You can equip different types of armarment for Stat purposes. In addition you can also choose a weapon, shield, hat or facegear for decoration, which will be seen ingame, if you fancy the look of a different weapon instead of the one you're currently wielding. That's an elegant solution to the age old problem of "Oh, this new weapon is badass! *equip* that's bloody ugly". I cherish that.

Also you have 12 commandslots at hand, which you can fill with items, weapons or spells. Makes for comfortable controls. 

The game contains 24 skills at the time. 7 passive skills are still not implemented. The skills you get to choose from are either Melee-, Magic- or Support-Types. Each skill has 10 Levels of it's own. You pay for a level with Skillpoints. Skillpoints come in two types. 
Blue ones, which pay for level 1 to 5.
Golden ones, which pay for level 6 to 10. 

The game also contains a Talenttree with 30 Talents in total. Talents can have level up to 3 or 5 with Talentpoints.

Obviously you get those points through leveling up.


[b]- Gameplay -[/b]

Your aim is to collect cards and do quests. While you do that you get around the World. Which has 7 differently themed areas for now. 

There's a card for every Monstertype except Bosses. Cards give passive boosts and are somewhat rare drops. You get them through Mobgrinding. The enemies respawn continously within the area, which allows for easy grinding.

You can get different pets, which give you stat-boosts as you train (feed) them. You choose one which walks around you. You can also change their skins/color.

Also you can craft a lot of different items. Which is rather simple. Just navigate through the receipe list and if you have enough materials, you can craft the item, wherever you are, at whatever time. As long as you can get into the menu, you can do that.

You have also the option to buy a house and decorate it. Since this is from the latest update I can't tell that much about it. Haven't used this function enough. 

[b]- Graphics -[/b]

If you like Pixelart, you will like this game's look. The artdesign is nice and with high level of detail. It feels just right.


[b]- Soundtrack -[/b]

I mute most games in favour of my own music, soooo.... I don't remember it well. But I remember that it did not annoy me, which is a feat most soundtracks don't achieve.

32660770.review:
Alright, so Ive played Secrets of Grindea for nearly 100 hours, here's what I have to say about the game so far.

First of all, I'd like to say that Secrets of Grindea can easily be seen as repetitive to those who don't manage to see the beauty of this game beyond just the "grinding". When this game first came out, I was the same way. But now that the developers have worked on this game and polished it up more and more, I've begun to enjoy it more as well.

So, the plot of the story is pretty good! I actually felt compelled to "end" of the story (at the time of writing this the game is not yet entirely done) and see what lies ahead. The characters are actually very memorable! And the names, dont even get me started, are pretty funny if you can catch afew puns here and there in them.

The mechanics are pretty explanitory in the name of the game itself. There is a chance you'll have to do A LOT of grinding if you're new to this kind of game or just want to kinda play it as it was designed to be played. The grinding is actually not boring, since you are actually doing it not just for money, or EXP, but for the rare cards that give you permanant bonuses that will help you out in the long run.

Since there are an abundance of items in this game, you can experiment with different setups. Whether it be 1 Handed, 2 Handed, or Magic, there is plenty for you to play for 15$. Though, at the moment, for me what seems to be the most powerful is Magic (Flamethrower and Cloud are OP in hard mode) and 1H (Shadow Clone is really good).

Now let me just explain a few negatives of this game.

The game can be kind of short depending on how fast you play and what you decide to do along your journey. Even though I took 100 hours, that doesnt quite mean that the game is extremely long, it just means I took my time to go through this game (obviously). 

I would like to ask the developers to possibly add a warning regarding taking your character to frontline mode. I recently put my character into the frontline beta mode and now I cannot take my character out of frontline. Please add a better warning so other people dont have to spend 40+ hours trying to get a new character up to speed with their original.

Last Id like to say that sometimes the artstyle sort of changes on the characters picture (the one that pops up when you engage in a convo with them) that can kind of feel slightly out of place. Im not saying it ruins the game drastically but perhaps the devs could look at it if they could and fix that XD

Thanks for making a good game on steam! Im so glad I invested 15$ for some good quality 18 bit awesomeness ^__^

Even in early access, this is one of the most flawless games I've ever played from a gameplay perspective. Co-Op on LAN is an absolute blast. The character customization via equipment and skill choices is top-notch. You can have / upgrade pets (but don't HAVE to have them to be viable, yet another sign of wonderful game design intuition). The combat requires strategy and forethought, not just mindless button mashing, The bosses are extremely well designed, and the main city hub has plenty to do apart from just chopping up shrubs. Take your time, devs, and by 1.2 or so, this game will be an absolute paragon of 2d isometric gaming. I only wish I could help bring it to fruition myself. 

To paraphrase the immortal words of Stephen Bray, "no proper review is complete without some sort of critique... So I guess this review is incomplete."

32320946.review:
Been playing this game now for well over 100+ hours, I'm THAT impressed with it that I have even made a guides page on my own website for it. IF your a fan of the 16bit era of 'action rpg' games, ones such as Legend of Zelda, Secret of Mana, Secret of Evermore, and Chrono Trigger THEN this game is certainly for you, you won't be disappointed.

Here's my PROS for BETA 0.007b release..

Graphics: The graphics in the game are very colorful, vibrant and unique to the game, it almost reminds me of Earthbound graphics for the Super Nintendo/Famicom. I would NOT change anything at all with them, it suits the game well. The icons, monsters, houses, shops, character design menu, magic spells, the menus, etc are all really great and fits in well with the game also.

Music/Sound Effects: These are great, all the music fits well in the areas that are in the game for you to visit, and the sound effects for spells are great also. The minor little things like walking past NPC's as they giggle at you or HO! HO! HO! as you get near them is a great addition. Dynamic sound effects such as getting closer to fountains the water gets louder etc is also implemented into the game, another nice addition.

Story: The story seems to be straight forward, collect 'Ancient Artifacts' that can help bring someone back to life, in the mean time there's someone keeping track of you gatehring these items for their own ends.. probably to rule the world or destory it.. (not got that far into the game where that person's reasons are revealed). So it's a pretty basic story but don't let that stop you getting this game.. it's fantastic.

Additional: There is tons of stuff to do in this game.. Crafting, Monster Card Hunting, Trophy Collecting & Achievements, Fishing, taking part in festival mini-games, Arena Challenges (solo and in challenge friends mode', Arcade Mode.. a soon to be added Housing System.. AND there is MUCH more planned for future update releases. The devs seems to be listening to the players and what they want, THIS is a good thing.. trust me.

Here are my CONS for BETA 0.007b release..

1. For the moment there's NOT that many side-quests in the game, it could do with more.
2. The areas have so much wasted space that they could do with adding more things into them, like more side-quests.
3. The towns dont have much to do in them to be honest.. other than 'Evergrind City', they need to add more stuff in.
4. The devs need to work on getting more updates out quicker, I know there's only 3 or 4 people working on this project but it's been going on now for a couple of years, and asking people for money to buy the game should give them the incentive to push updates out faster.

Conclusion: In any case, the game is fantastic as it is for the moment, it's certainly a game I will be recommending to people on my website and also to the 'Facebook Groups' i'm a member of that are old school rpg gaming based. I can't wait for the game to be fully finished so I am able to play it right through without having to stop at certain points and wait for the next lot of patches to come out. So what you doing reading THIS..? go buy and PLAY IT NOW!

32172756.review:
這款遊戲非常符合我的口味，本身就很熱愛「像素風」的作品，加上戰鬥方式和技能組合的多項化，讓我對這款遊戲的評價又更上一層。因為我是在2017年6月左右購買的，所以我並不會像一些玩家感到更新速度很慢，所以在這點上我就不給予評論了。

首先從畫面來看:
遊戲整體是積極地想要營造出2.5D的感覺，打從一開始出生的城鎮和遺跡就可以看的出來，
在房間和地形物的刻畫上也是挺細緻的，可能就是角色肖像這邊我有點不習慣，但這也單純是個人品味問題，所以不列入考量。

音樂方面:
我是覺得整體的音樂並沒有太突出的地方，因為緊湊的戰鬥和繁忙的故事情節過於搶戲，讓人很難去注意到，
但有個地方不得不吐槽一下，就是在夏洛蒂保護爸爸那邊，如果音樂處理得當，我應該就會哭出來了(爸爸真他媽個屁孩)。

劇情方面:
不管在支線或主線，都可以稍微看到作者試著想要打破第四道牆，特別是袋子說話的時候，這點我覺得很有趣味，
主線的話不外乎就是跑來跑去蒐集東西(怕劇透，就只講這樣了)，支線的話，我覺得是作者比較下功夫的，
像是不可缺少的地圖彩蛋及各式跑腿打雜，但是多樣的支線讓遊戲整體顯得繁忙也使得整個遊戲在自由度和趣味上大大的加了一分，利用這點來抓住玩家「我解完這個任務就關遊戲」，至少在我是這樣，不知不覺就通宵了...

戰鬥方面:
我會買這款遊戲就是因為他的戰鬥方式和整體給人「Zelda Style」的感覺，但是作者豐富了戰鬥的多樣化，使整個系統煥然一新。
配合上大量的解謎，使遊戲在閒暇和緊湊中取的了一個平衡，但也有可能因為這個因素而使整個遊戲環繞著緊張和壓力，這點可能要在拿捏一下，畢竟這款遊戲在小怪和boss方面都還挺血尿的就是了。

總結，非常值得一玩的遊戲!

以上是我個人的觀點和看法，畢竟我對像素風的作品毫無抵抗力，在這其中可能也有強烈的主觀意識，
所以還請有著歧異的玩家見諒。

31893935.review:
So far, I like this game, but my biggest issue with it is that there are no health potions, nor are their energy potions, and if there are potions like those, where can I get them?

I've been stuck at the Hydras for ages now and I'd love to have some health potions, at least.

Other than that, this game feels a lot like Legend of Zelda to me and a bit like Chrono Trigger.. The graphics remind me of Maplestory...for some reason.

I do like the combat/skill system but the controls are a bit weird to me. 

And like this one guy said, the difficulty spikes up for no reason, like you would be doing fine and having little to no issues killing mobs, when suddenly, you get your ass handed to you countless times by a boss. Honestly, I'd recommend the devs to lower the difficulty or at least add something that makes the combat way less frustrating to do.. I mean, the boss battles are so god damn difficult that I rage quit for an hour or so and there's no indication of what you SHOULD do in the boss battles, they just expect you to know what to do.

I do love the multiplayer idea, and it seems like it would be a good idea to go for it at level 10 since the game starts kicking your ass by then...That is if you have any friends that want this game because it's rather unknown.

And like I said before, I'd love it if they added health/energy potions, it would make combat more bearable to do because EVERYTHING wants you dead and will make sure of it. This game is like the Dark Souls of Old-School RPGs.

Character creation is pretty okay, would be nice to be able to change outfits and such.

Magic is pretty damn useful from what I've seen so far, I hadn't tried Melee all that much, but if you're looking to be a mage, then you'll love it. Most of the spells do some pretty good damage and while there are no healing spells yet (which is weird.) you should be able to keep normal mobs off of you without a problem...usually.

And yes, as the name suggests, you do have to grind EXP..very..very often. Maybe a bit too often. Reason why is again, the bosses can kick your ass in seconds. lol

This is kind of an "Ehhhhhhh" to me, but I still recommend it, I've never played a game that's pissed me off, and frustrated me so much until now. I'm all for difficulty but it feels very unfriendly to players. Honestly, I recommend waiting for this game to release (or at least half-way done) to play it, because at least by then they may have health/energy potions and healing, hopefully.

Pros - Lots of content and a very charming world full of vibrant characters and humor. This game also gives a lot of love to old-school games through it's faithful interpretation of the old-school gameplay mechanics in an updated, new-school game. No is left wanting for customizability either, as there is plenty of variety of weapons the class system is comprehensive and rewards the imaginative. 

Cons - This game is NOT easy. Though many, myself included, welcome the challenge; if you are looking for an easy game to chill out and relax with, this is not it. Also, updates are still coming out for the game (it is still in BETA) but they take a very long time to come out usually. 

I have only put a few hours in this game, but even still, it's a lot of fun and a nice balance of retro game style and new school features and content. I'm really enjoying the story so far as well.  Would def recommend!

31719103.review:
Lots, lots of potential. Beautiful art-style; it's rare to see such a breathtaking view when playing games with this sort of art-style but it really works here. The music is also serene and arcade-y. Will bring mad nostalgia to 80s and 90s kids, and is an exemplary game for younger audience who want to understand the value of classic games when it's executed well. 

It is however in early access and is still unfinished, albeit well polished. I do believe it sill has a long way to go, as it's not just missing a few items, but missing whole skill trees. There's also not much NPC interaction, and the combat can get stale if you're grinding. 

As you can see, I don't have that many hours in this game so I don't blame you if you don't believe me. I do think it's a good game, but it needs to really pick up and hook the audience if it expects a complete playthrough. The combat in itself is not varied and interesting enough to be the main reason to play this game. Even the art-style, arguably the game's strongest point, is the kind of art-style that will illicit "wow"s and "woo"s and "cool"s and "nice"s, but it's not going to keep gamers coming back. The devs need to work on the longevity of the game, but it has undoubtedly a very strong first impression. 

I'm always very cautious when reviewing early access games as I'm not sure whether to review the current build or the final product (which one can only guess). 

Current build: 72.5/100
If they manage to deliver everything as promised: 75/100 
If they deliver everything as promised and fine tune the combat, add more loot and interactable NPCS: 80/100

31596160.review:
[h1]A mixture of really fun RPG with really frustrating elements[/h1]

To start, I do recommend this game, however it's not without its qualities that I absolutely dislike.

That's not to say they're faults of the game, just that they make [i]me[/i] angry enough to need a break. 

There are so many things about this game done right, the artwork is well done, the sound and music is pretty spot on, and the story is decent so far. 
I enjoy the combat and the leveling+skill system all feels pretty good, despite there still being some unfinished skills. 

I also really like the items and collecting in the game, what with unique drops, elite monsters, etc.

About the only thing that turns me off about the game is that some of the boss battles and puzzles can drag the experience on, artificially inflating actual play time. 

I fought the first real boss, a giant robot, and kept dying, trying to take it down in its last stage. What I didn't know, without checking the guide, [spoiler]is that it will die automatically, after its last stage, so you basically just have to avoid its bullets for a little while, till it dies.[/spoiler] I'm not a fan of having to look at a guide online, just because the game doesn't indicate its mechanics clearly enough.

A character could easily say something like "It's imploding on itself, just stay out of its way, and we're almost there!" or something. There was no indication of what I should do, and this, frankly, is what happens quite a bit in the game. You're supposed to just "know" something completely random in order to progress. 

Another gripe I have is that the difficulty spikes a lot, in various different places. You'll be feeling pretty proud of yourself for beating a boss, or grinding up a dozen levels. You'll be killing everything without issue, feeling like a bad@$$, and then suddenly your face gets smashed in by a boss that seems to be dozens of levels too high for you. 

This will happen a lot, which left me feeling like "am I going to have a good time, or am I suddenly going to face a challenge that frustrates me for two hours?" 

Also on my list of annoyances are the puzzles. I spent two hours trying to solve a single puzzle last night. In the end, I caved and looked at a guide. The solution rather pissed me off, because it was the ONLY solution involving moving around 12 pieces. So, a puzzle that involves 12 pieces on a grid of let's say 40X80, to find the exact right way to place each piece, this wasn't fun. The room design for that puzzle also wasn't at all suggestive of a solution, which is something most good games with puzzles do, suggest a solution through the level design.

You'd think with all my complaining, I'd not recommend this game, and in fact you'd be wrong.

Regardless of its downfalls, things that I personally don't like, it's a really good game. As I mentioned above, the leveling is good (super grindy, but what did you expect from Secrets of Grindea), the skill system, the art style, the music, the item collection, crafting, story... 

All of it is done quite well.

If you're into retro-styled RPGs, with very definite nods to the past, you'll probably like this one, even if it does make you feel stupid, from time to time.

I have played this game for 80+ hours, with 5+ different save slots used, each one using a different offensive strategy to play the game with. I have done 1-handed, 2-handed, magic of various combinations and all of them are very enjoyable. That being said, I have enjoyed this game so much all throughout each one of my runs. 

The story is phenomenal and I keep noticing new aspects of the story that I didn't before. All of the boss fights are great. Each boss fight has its own mechanic that makes each one unique and fun. There are also a ton of options for character customizations: hairstyles; hair, skin, scarf, shirt, pants, and shoe color.

As with most early access games, there are some bugs and glitches, but the developers are very active and will fix the bugs/glitches that are pointed out to them on the forums.

There is also multiplayer with up to 4 people total. In my experience with trying to use this, it did not work. I could not play local multiplayer with my friends, and when we tried doing online multiplayer using each of our accounts and hooking up via Steam, it did not recognize that I had any friends with the game. It would be nice if that got fixed.

There are people that complain about how grindy the game is, but honestly, there is no need to grind, but if you do grind, the art style is nice to look at while grinding. A lot of the monsters are really cool.

Overall, the developers really care about this game and put a lot of effort into making this a quality game. Definitely worth every bit of the $15 they are asking for. Solid 9.5/10.comes out.

31472170.review:
This cute, grind-y RPG has great pixel graphics and a pleasing soundtrack, and the characters have a lot of personality. The puzzles are satisfying, and the ability to tame different pets has a unique mechanic. The bosses and their accompanying temples are fun and challenging, requiring you to utilize new skills you pick up along the way. There's a great story to follow, and I look forward to each installment as the areas are added.

I don't regret purchasing this title in its Early Access phase because, although the content is slowly added, I am able to watch everything develop. Usually I only see the finished product, but it's a neat experience to see everything come together. I will say that the controls are a little awkward, but I've managed to come up with a workable system with a fourteen-button gamer mouse. That's my only complaint, and it doesn't detract from my gameplay enough to push me away.

I was hesitant at first to purchase it when some of the reviews accused this game of being impossibly slow to update. There's always that fear with Early Access games that the developer will decide to abandon it in its unfinished state and leave you wanting more. However, the developers do post pretty regularly, and they have an outside blog that is very thorough about their progress and future plans. (I'm eager for the next update, which will apparently include player housing! Sounds exciting.)

All in all, I recommend this game for a lot of different reasons, although I wish I could get some of my friends to play it. I'm sure it would be a lot of fun to try in multiplayer. I think once it's finally finished and polished up I will have more luck. Keep up the great work, devs!

31281354.review:
There is already enough there to justify a purchase, even if progress is slow.

Character building is flexible.  Control is tight.  Boss fights are SNES-era multi-stage endeavors.  It's easy to see how it would take a small team a long time to make this content.

You can check out their blog and judge for yourself whether they're on a proper pace.  There's even a free demo.

I wouldn't expect a 100% finished game this year, but we already have a 100% playable and fun SNES-style game that looks 60-70% finished content-wise.  The quality and variety is competitive with old-school SNES ARPGs, and this is all coming from a much smaller team than who was making similar games in the 90s.  It's a great mix of nostalgia with enough innovation to make it their own.  They are maintaining a steady pace and consistency of quality so far.

It isn't humanly possible to do it much faster, and if you want a complete game fast, you can hold your money instead of your breath when it comes to this title.

31073485.review:
Meh....
This game is ok. 
Definitely overrated here on steam though.


For one thing it's one of THEE most slow to develope games I have ever seen. Barely only faster then games like Starforge which quit development. If you buy this, don't expect a complete game for at least 20 years. Don't be surprised if they never properly finish either (rushed content). 


STANDARD ISSUE JRPG STORY?
I don't personally care for the story much, and the gameplay is extremely repetitive (go into field, whack the mobs, repeat). 


OTHER GAME MECHANICS?
They added all sorts of things to do like fishing and crafting but non of these extra things are well designed nor very fun.
Fishing is annoying to do, trying to keep a small area lined up on a moving line or you lose the fish, and it's very unforgiving if catching a big fish. Probably the most uninteresting way to add fishing, even more boring then how ARK does it *quick time events*

Crafting is structured in a way so that you never get higher level tier materials. You will only ever find CURRENT story progress relevant level materials, ensuring you can only ever make gear that is almost identicle in stats to what can be purchased at the store, or found as loot. There is no way to get future gear that makes current dungeons easier. Great, but, SO WHY HAVE CRAFTING THEN? IT doesn't do anything else and feels so hopelessly tacked on. It isn't even interesting in HOW you craft. Just get the mats, hit a button, done. 
You don't harvest resources either, the mats are just from killing monsters. Seriously this crafting system is here only so they can brag about having a crafting system to sucker people into buying this ho hum game. =3


BOSSY!
The boss fights are intense, and the only hard part unless you don't take time to grind for a while (Note I played on hardest)- you need to be a master at not stepping into the fire, and gear\stats is secondary in importance. Expect to die die die die die over and over again trying to learn some of these fights, especially WINTER boss. Hard mode will definitely not be for everyone here.


The music was fair.
The art is really high quality.
Controls are fluid.
My butt is acid.
erm...

What else am I forgetting?

The roguelike mode was a HUUUUUUUUUUUGE disappointment. It isn't some random dungeons like your favorite roguelike game with exploration, oh no, it's more like playing smash TV with each room being a small arena and a few mobs to kill so the door to the next room unlocks. It's the near same thing everytime, same mobs, same pretty much everything. The only fun thing about it, is unlocking new shops and stuff in town to help future playthroughs not be as boring (hopefully).


The Secrets of Grindea are not much of a secret, and this game is only some small bits of fun to me. But this isn't exactly my bag baby, what with secret of mana not being amazing to me either. That is the game this is most similar to from the past I'd say, and most people will adore this game as the very high steam rating can show you.

I recommend it, only because I know everyone is less jaded then me on games like this! But seriously dev team, finish it sometimes this decade please!

31063010.review:
I played the whole game until the end of the "current beta" (Spoilers)

While the game is rich there are a lot of things that really made this game a bad experience:

Combat seems to offer a lot at first sight but after playing it has a lot of flaws. I did not suck at combat, i think i did pretty well, i also farmed nearly all cards, but during combat a always felt annoyed, they are a chore:
- The deeper into the game the more unbearable the combat system becomes. At first everything is fine and plays decent, enemies have some advertised charge abilities and some require you to block or dodge.
- Then suddenly the enemies start to kite like hell and abuse your 4 directional attack restrictions of your abilities by dodging diagonally all the time (Skycastle). Next you have the Snowball jugging guys in the snow-areas which throw nearly invisible projectiles at you.
- The gift-box enemies just throw an infinite amount of bombs at you to create random area-denial which taunts you to respec your combat style to spells but this costs much gold
- The season temple was ok, except for the hydra fight which shows what is the biggest problem for the remaining game: The game sets up a framework for combat, and then completely cripples this framework by denying you in all sorts of ways in order to create artificial difficulty.

[b]Good games create the challenge around the tools it hands to you, not by giving you good tools and then break them.[/b]

The hydra either does Area denial in a much too small arena, makes you blind (what a shitty design choice) or removes your ability to move responsively (ice-floor, even when you have the spiky boots) in a battle that requires evasion of charges, so you are fully dependend on your dodge ability, which makes the fight pretty easy again, as if the developer wants you to do things a certain way, like Apple. The fight vs the Winter-dude sucks because it has so much randomness and badly advertised attacks. I decide therefore to just gimp him by blocking the storm that was supposed to lure me the the opposite site of his long vincibility frame with the mushroom shield. This creates a blind-patch that boosted my crit by 25. That and a dmg-potion and he can be killed after two of his "i just wait 30s until you pass through my ice-maze that totally abuses the shitty movement to damage you"-phases. Did i mention that diagonal movment isnt normalized? so you move Root of 2 faster when moving diagonally.

The game has its zenit in the Crystal-cave- zone where every enemy and NPC is just designed to piss you off until you just skip them.
There are Worms that create Area Denial patches everywhere that must be outwaited in order to take no dmg. Mushrooms create blinding fields if you vanquish them. Shell Monsters do a random charge-bounce thing that is so fast that it WILL hit you randomly... All this artificial crippling is shoved into your face one last time with the fight vs the Power-Flower in order to remind you why you hate this games combat.

After that you are having the most annoying npc interaction of the game so far with a caveling that is scamming you obviously, but you have to follow through and at the end you are completely mocked, 2 minutes later the game ends.


Other:
- You cannot really try every skill without grinding loads of gold because there is a somewhat hefty fee required everytime you want to respec your points. There is no way of trying abilities without spending your sparse points into it, maybe save game manipulation, the descriptions are detailed though
- The bag (your travaling companion) constantly patronizes you and is in general a scum-bag (pun anyone?). It comments on your inferiorness every time you die, which really feels discouraging because some battles are really badly implemented and always regards you as an incapable kid through the course of the game. I would throw this thing away immidiately if i was given the option.
- While the Pixelart-Animation is wonderful and very fluid, the Background Artwork lacks some texturing at the snow and grass areas which make them feel like MS-Paint-Jobs. The Woods and Caves are gorgeous. The dialog-box-faces look strangely out of place and i wonder if they where made by a different artist

30969746.review:
Это мой первый обзор игр. Но постараюсь быть придельно ясен. Поехали.

Наиграл в игру порядка 35 часов. (пару часов на пиратке)

Начну с плюсов:

+ Сюжет.
Да, игра еще находится в разработке, но сюжета уже достаточно. Он достаточно примитивен, но все равно очень и очень приятный. 
+ Юмор.
Добрый приятный юмор в этой игре постоянно. Сумка не даст вам скучать своими шутками и подколами. 
+ Умения. 
В игре есть по сути 3 ветви развития персонажа. Ближний бой с одноручным и двуручным мечами и магия. Очень много скиллов, которые можно откатывать, если есть монеты и брать другие. 

Минусы:

-Щит.
После долго времени игры я все же решил выделить именно этот параметр. 
Щит мгновенно ставится перед персонажем по нажатию клавиши, но когда гг поднимает его, он не может крутиться, от чего в крупных боях, часто получаешь в спину. 
-Герой тормоз.
Да, именно так. После ударов наш протагонист стоит на месте примерно 1/3 секунды. Ты конечно можешь бить сколько влезет, но нормально повернуться или отойти у тебя уже не выйдет.

30965608.review:
So I really love the beginning of this game. It was just perfect. Exactly what I was looking for and I had so much fun. Just perfectly blocking stuff to reflect it, dodging things by using Skills, trying to figure out some puzzles. It was so much fun.
But I didn't like the Tai Ming Part that much, because it's just boss fight, fight vs 1000 mobs where parrying is useless and you just have to run around, followed by another boss fight, followed by a fight vs 1000 mobs... and so on. It's just not that much fun in my opinion, and the outplay potential is pretty low there.
But after finishing all the available quests I started enjoying the game again. Because after that I started grinding till I got every single item, monster card and so on.


So long term short: I loved the beginning of the game, but I don't like how it's developing. I just hope that they will get back to the style from the start of the game. But overall, I think this game is very enjoyable.

30858443.review:
Analise do beta V650a (Modo Campanha) :

Jogabilidade: 10
Gráficos: 10
Trilha Sonora: 8
tradução (português-BR): 8

Esse com toda certeza é um dos melhores jogos que já joguei. Trouxe uma nostalgia absurda sobre os jogos do gênero, com uma jogabilidade totalmente diferente de tudo que tive o prazer de experimentar. Mesmo o jogo ainda em construção eu garanto que vai proporcionar horas e mais horas de diversão sendo no modo ( singleplayer ) ou (multiplayer). A dificuldade do jogo é desafiadora, tanto no modo (Normal) quanto no (Hard), e é claramente divertido se sentir um colecionador com tantas coisas para adquirir no jogo.

Claro como todos os jogos com inumeros pontos positivos, sempre há alguma coisa a acrescentar. O sistema de cartas ainda está um pouco vago, na minha humilde opinião seria melhor se o album mostrasse pelo menos a imagem cinza das cartas.
Ex: Eu fiquei mega em dúvida se a carta Guardião caia ou não, ou se a slime azul era a msm da slime verde. Foi a única coisa que senti falta nesse beta, fora isso é um dos melhores jogos do gênero, se não o melhor.

30738404.review:
This game was an extreme disappointment. My friend and I had been looking forward to this game for months and when my friend bought it for me as a surprise I was ecstatic. Now all I feel is guilt that they paid money on this unfinished garbage and am hoping the refund goes through.The game seemed beautiful, but how this game looks in gameplay videos and the trailer is incredibly decieving. Don't let it fool you- there's only a few hours of story content here, and not even good story at that. You won't be getting much out of this game other than the pretty visuals, and there are plenty of much better pixel art games out there that you could buy.

While playing through with my friend we encountered multiple glitches that made the game unplayable or forced us to close it in order to get out of a never-ending loop of glitches. The storyline is nowhere near finished and hasn't been updated in months (if it ever plans to be finished). Don't even get me started on the rougelike. (It's not fun in the slightest and just seems like a shoddy thrown together attempt to make the buyers stop complaining about lack of content)

Overall the best description of this game is soulless. It felt like it was made for the purpose of enticing people to pay more money than what the minimal amount of content is worth, It looks appealing to the eyes, but has no replayability and runs out of content incredibly quickly. This game is not and will never be worth 15 dollars in it's unfinished state, and it says directly on their dev blog they never plan to put it on sale  until it is finished, and I feel like there's a better reason for that than the shoddy one that the dev blog claims. As evidenced by the amount of content that has been put out in the past two years, they seem to be putting out the minimal amount of content to give the buyers hope that this game isn't completely abandoned.

Don't purchase this game. You'll regret it and be hoping for a refund like I am.

30738285.review: This game is the biggest disappointment I've ever spent money on. 30606396.review:
Secrets of Grindea is an exersize in nostalgia for me. The game feels and plays much like Secret of Mana and Secrets of Evermore, both games which influenced my childhood and love for RPG's. Secrets of Grindea is one of my favourite games on steam, period.

My wife and I have spend many hours playing this game together, fighting bosses, grinding equipment, enjoying the soundtrack and even discussing gameplay and where we hope the game will go from here, many hours after we've finished a session. We both hope the game does wonderfully, and that the team who makes it keeps up their hard work!

It's good to see such talent in the game industry, and I hope the creators are very proud of themselves for the piece of art they've built. I know I certainly am proud of them.

That being said, the game is very much early access, and the campaign isn't quite finished yet. It looks like there's a long way to go yet, and I eagerly devour each and every update as it's put out.

If you liked Secret of Mana, and enjoy a good old fashioned item gathering rpg, pick this game up now. Better yet, get 2 copies and play with a friend- It's definitely worth it.

30603549.review: when the fuck will you guys update this game?? WE ARE WAITING!!!!

30588152.review:
Do not buy this game right now, but definitely put it on your wishlist and buy it immediately when it's finished.

Assuming you're looking at this now because it's been recommended by Steam, or you're searching for the kind of game that is reminiscent of Secrets of Mana/Chrono Trigger/Any of those classic SNES RPGs, you're going to absolutely want this game, but don't spoil the experience by getting it now.  It's so good.  They've gotten the feeling of an old school RPG down perfectly, but married it with modern playability and UI.  I've played it with my two best friends in coop and it brought us back over a decade to nights we'd spend sitting around a TV enjoying old consoles together.

Secrets of Grindea's store page is the one that I visit most frequently, watching the updates hoping for content completion, because its gameplay is perfection, but when I played it was 25% content complete, and I was pretty disillusioned when we hit that wall.  I want the full experience, and I'm chomping at the bit.

I know development takes a long time, especially with a small team, and they're doing a phenomenal job, but if I could, I'd go back and stop myself from playing until the full game was released.

30351830.review:
Having not grown up with this sort of game, i did not feel any nostalgia while playing it. However, that didnt stop me from really enjoying it. 

Its still in beta, but the story still gave me about 10 hours of gameplay, and it also has an arcade mode which is based on the fighting parts of the story. As of writing this review, i have spent 2 hours in the arcade mode, and I doubt i will be stopping there.

Dont let the fact that it's still in beta stop you from at least thinking about this game, as its already really good. Parts of the world map aren't free for players to explore as of now, and im sure they will take very long to make as the game looks astoundingly beautiful, but what there is currently is great. The main quest is also still not finished, it just abruptly stopped, though there is still alot of it. As i said, the game gave me 10 hours of gameplay, which i find is a very suitable amount of time for a game.

The story consists of puzzles, bullet hell styled boss fights, combat, side quests and obiously the story itself. Some of the puzzles were actually quite hard, to the point where i had to look up gameplay videos find out the solution, while others were a decent head scratcher that wouldn't last too long, or too short. The boss fights all take a couple tries to beat, but never enrage you like other games (namely shovel knight). 

I recommend this game to everyone, though especially to people who like The legend of Zelda, and other RPGs like it.

30349416.review:
Secrets of Grindea（译名：格兰蒂亚秘闻之卡牌都去哪了）
朋友安利来玩的
不得不说这部作品的确是很优秀的正统日式RPG
创意工坊自带中文
要剧情有剧情
要支线有支线
能合成能收集
能收宠物能钓鱼
能换衣服能换发型
BGM轻松愉快
怪的设计调皮（？）可爱
绝对满足你对rpg的一切渴望

刚打开时可能会有rpgmaker的既视感
不过玩下去就会发现作者异常良心
游戏里几乎全部的人
都有自己的头像和名字
很多人还有自己的独特动作
（比如擦玻璃啊，吃东西啊，玩牌啊）
怪被打死的样子都是几帧的小动画
对话调侃极多
很轻松愉快地就玩下去了
接任务也不会觉得
“哎呀没头绪啊”
“哎呀这任务去哪做啊”
虽然仅限前中期hhhh

即时战斗做得很不错
手感无违和
如果操作好是可以做到
万怪丛中过，一滴血不掉
单双手武器也可以按自己的习惯来点主动技能
掌握好节奏完全是砍瓜切菜

这么一款优秀的游戏
问题在哪呢
一个是它还未完成
8、9小时能打完目前完成的部分
现在的心情大概是看文遇到更新不定的作者
你能做到的也只有哭求大爷你快点更吧
大爷你可别坑啊

另一个
就是极受大家称赞的掉率
这游戏你想全收集
是要付出本篇10倍以上时间的（还未必能做到）
不光是怪的掉落物刷不全
还有个卡牌的设定
它能提供额外的属性加成
每个怪都有一个
官方在游戏里介绍说是：
你能拿到这个说明你对这个怪已经很熟悉了
是啊
很 熟 悉 了
有的怪打3只就掉
有的怪你打3000只没准都不掉
纯看脸

就像昨晚我刷了4个小时
为了刷兔子的卡
刷到什么程度呢
刷到我用这种新手怪从21级升到了22级
刷了至少也有几百只
我的心情从最开始的
嘤嘤嘤兔兔好可爱的不忍心打
到后来的
卧槽你还有脸跑滚回来让老子一刀一个
兔子都去死去死去死去死去死

最后
卡是出来了
它的最后一个掉落物还没刷出来
这还只是一种怪
一种好打好刷的怪
蜜蜂什么的我就不说了
玩过的估计都要一起抱头哭
爱上一个游戏
内心全是弹幕

整体来说还是很推荐这款游戏的
不过这游戏从出就没打过折
48这个价位还是有点贵
何况是花钱入坑等更
不急着玩的
不妨愿望单
等两年再看看吧

30160942.review:
é um Early acess indie muito caro pra ainda estar em desenvolvimento. O jogo não tem uma história bem definada ou bem escrita e foca mais em fazer piadinhas e clichês- o que é comum em jogos que apostam no visual nostálgico para vender - e isso é ok até... é a proposta do jogo. Mas vai chegar no 3º ano que o jogo está em early acess. Há atualizações periódicas que geralmente tratam do visual do jogo e arrumar bugs... mas a história principal do jogo anda lento. No blog dos desenvolvedores você vê atividade ao menos três vezes por mês... geralmente mostrando novas artes e sprites de móveis, jarros, bosses, etc... e ai você vê o blog de desenvolvimento e percebe que o jogo está em desenvolvimento a SEIS ANOS.

O arcade mode é divertido, para você acumular mais de 2 horas no jogo (tempo que leva a campanha atual) provavelmente é porque está jogando esse modo. Se o jogo fosse só o arcade mode ia ser bem maneiro. O jogo está traduzido em diversas línguas, inclusive português, o que é divertido. A possibildiade de jogar em co-op a campanha e o arcade também são muito divertidos. Mas todos esses pontos positivos você encontra em outros jogos completos, mais bem feitos, com preços melhores.
 
O jogo não é original, está sendo desenvolvido lentamente, não tem nada que outros jogos não possuem (e até com mais qualidade)... mas  nada disso me incomodaria se não fosse o preço desse criança: atualmente vinte oito reais. Não vale a pena. Se quiser comprar espere ele ficar pronto. Com essa grana você compra vários jogos indies (ou não) que contém todos os prós do jogo aqui na steam: sem história profunda, cheio de humor, visual nostálgico, co-op e o melhor: completo.

29764467.review:
Primero que nada quiero dejar en claro que es un excelente juego y que merece todo el apoyo de la comunidad, tiene un gran futuro y cuenta actualmente con bastante contenido para el deleite de los usuarios.
Pero como todo titulo este también tiene sus puntos negativos y considero que necesita una corrección rápida de estos puntos, ya que en ciertas situaciones llega a ser muy frustrante.

Pros:
-	1: Gran variedad de objetos y habilidades, otorgando la posibilidad de elaborar en juego tardío lo que se conoce como builds. Esto también facilita el juego en su inicio.
-	2. Gran cantidad de contenido para encontrarse en acceso temprano.
-	3. Excelente Pixel Graphics
-	4. Cuenta con modo Cooperativo, tanto para el modo historia como para el Arcarde.
-	5. Los Puzles son bastante buenos.
-	6. Rogue-like
-	7. Elementos externos como las cartas que añaden más objetivos y alargan la vida del juego.
-	8. Contenido para más de 100 horas de juego.

Contras:

1. Dificultad

La dificultad en modo Arcade llega a ser muy elevada, a tal punto que las partidas pueden durar hasta 4 horas en lo que vas del piso 1 al 12, todo ocurre debido al poco margen de error que existe, obligándote a ser extremadamente cuidadoso, si te equivocas por un segundo veras notablemente las consecuencias.

Aunque los jefes y monstros cuentan con patrones pre-definidos, esto no facilita la experiencia en este modo de juego, pero si te obliga al 100% a memorizar todos estos patrones para poder completar este modo, por lo tanto considero que este juego debería tener la etiqueta de Difícil, ya que el modo Arcade se ve extremadamente por el margen de error tan pequeño que existe entre un ataque y otro.

¿Qué tanto afecta esto la experiencia en el Modo Arcade?

Mucho, garantizo que morirás al menos unas 50 veces antes de que logres llegar al piso 6. Y al ser este modo tan similar a The Binding of Isaac, lógicamente con cada muerte perderás tu progreso, pero iras sumando puntos que van desbloqueando beneficios al inicio de la partida. Esto no garantiza ni facilita el juego en el modo Arcade, y es la frustración principalmente lo que hace de este modo de juego el menos entretenido y menos recomendado.

En el caso del modo historia, este no se ve afectado por el margen de error ya que al final no perderás tu progreso con tu muerte y todo sigue siendo prueba y error. Aunque algunos jefes se te harán imposibles en la dificultad difícil, realmente sufrirás te lo garantizo.

Fuera de esto no he encontrado otro punto negativo, pero es sumamente importante nuevamente recalcar que es muy frustrante el modo Arcade y si eres una persona temperamental independientemente no recomiendo este título, ya que con más de 4000 horas que tengo en los mobas y después de a ver experimentado un nivel por encima de la tercera dimensión de la frustración. Con este juego por fin he podido experimentar eso que llaman la cuarta dimensión, es un nivel de frustración tan grande que ya he cambiado varias veces de teclado.
 
!!!!!Sí buscas un titulo RPG con un toque de Rogue-Like, con un excelente Apartado en 2D dando honores a los Pixel Graphics y una dificultad que te obligara a aprenderte hasta el mas mínimo de los patrones de cada boss y enemigo para evitar ser brutalmente asesinado y terminar tirando tu teclado por la ventana, este es tu juego.!!!!!

Recomendado! Por amor a diosss corrijan el modo Arcade ya he muerto lo suficiente, creo que estoy ciego.

29709482.review:
Das Spiel ist jetzt schon seit 2 Jahren im Early Access und die Entwickler scheinen sehr fleißig an dem Spiel zu arbeiten.

Secrets of Grindea ist ein RPG Adventure mit einem sehr schönem Skill- und Kampfsystem. Der Fokus bei dem Spiel liegt ganz klar auf die schöne deatliert gestaltete Welt. Für mich ist Secrets of Grindea das beste Beispiel dafür, dass ein Spiel auch ohne ultra realistische Grafik extrem schön aussehen kann. 

Das Kampfsystem ist eben nicht das Actionreichste, aber dennoch hat man viel Individualität beim skillen und somit kommt auch ein wenig mehr Abwechlsung beim kämpfen rein. Man kann seine skills jederzeit für ingame Gold "refunden" und neu verteilen, was jedoch ein wenig zu teuer ist.

Die Story ist eine Mischung aus witzig und ernst. Wir sind der Sohn von einem Vater der ein "Collector" ist. Wir müssen am Anfang des Spiels eine Prüfung zum "Collector" ablegen um in die Fußstapfen unseres Vaters zu treten und wertvolle Artefakte und Geheimnisse der Welt zu erkunden. Die Story ist keine große Besonderheit und eher mittelmäßig. Aber dennoch gibt es die ein oder anderen witzigen Dialoge, jedoch kommt Spannung bisher eher wenig auf. 

Die größte Besonderheit von Secrets of Grindea im Abenteuer Modus ist die RPG Welt ansich. Es gibt viele Secrets zu erkunden und viele Items die man sammeln kann. Neben vielen Style Items, gibt es auch Karten von Gegner die dir einen permanenten Bonus auf diverse stats geben. Es gibt einige Waffe und Ausrüstung die man finden oder kaufen kann, welche speziell für Magie oder Physich gedachte sind. Neben dem Finden von Ausrüstung kann man sich auch Ausrüstung craften. Überall kann man Materialien finde, welche entweder fürs craften sind oder für bestimmte Quests.
Einer meiner großen Highlight im Spiel waren bisher die Tempel. Die Tempel sind sehr innovativ und bis auf das kleinste Detail sehr schön gestaltet. Neben Rätsel gibt es dort auch Bosse die allesamt mit einer bestimmten Taktik besiegt werden müssen. Die Tempel sind leider etwas zu klein, aber dafür extrem gut gemacht.

Anonsten gibt es noch einen Arcade Modus, wo man sich durch mehrere Ebenen kämpfen. MAn startet quasi mit null Ausrüstung und findet von Ebene zu Ebene immer mehr und bessere. Es gibt auch einen vorteilhaften Start, den man sich erspielen kann. Der Modus ist besonders gut für Spieler die einen guten Highscroe hinlegen wollen, oder einfach eine Herausforderung suchen.  

Das Spiel ist wahrscheinlich noch lange nicht fertig, jedoch ist es bisher wirklich ein sehr gutes Indie Adventure RPG. Wer Lust auf ein schönes Adventure hat, der sollte sich das Spiel nicht entgehen lassen.

입맛에 맞게 캐릭터의 스킬을 찍고 아이템을 구해 장비하며 레벨을 올리는 성장형 RPG게임이다.

메인퀘스트와 사이드퀘스트를 수행하며 일반 RPG처럼 진행하는 스토리 모드와 로그라이크 방식으로 더 많은 스테이지를 클리어하는 아케이드 모드가 있다.

정식출시가 안됐음에도 즐길거리가 제법 있으며, 아케이드 모드 뿐 아니라 스토리 모드까지 코옵을 지원한다는 점에서 높은 점수를 주고 싶다.

- 장점 : 다양하게 성장시킬수 있는 캐릭터 육성의 자유도, 쉽게 질리지 않는 아케이드 모드, 양쪽 게임모드에서 잘 동작하는 코옵
- 단점 : 스토리 모드에 등장하는 수많은 요정npc들(개발자의 유전자가 영향을 끼쳤을까 싶다)

29413323.review:
I purchased Secrets of Grindea for myself and 3 other friends and I'm in love. Lists are easy and fun to read, so here we go:

-Pros-
-The storyline and dialogue are amazing. Very few games give me the sense of adventure and laughs that Grindea has
-Art and music directory is great, with a vast, diverse world to explore
-Multiplayer is incredibly fun. If early Legend of Zelda had multiplayer, it would come really close to this
-The items and characters are rich and addicting, making you explore and grow

-Cons-
-Multiplayer took some toying around to get to work, but was manageable
-The controls feel foreign to start, which can be discouraging

Overall, Secrets of Grindea stands solid on its own, but with friends, it knocks the genre out of the park.

Não sei se posso recomendar esse jogo, ele é divertido por umas horas mas não é um bom jogo, vou listar os fatores.

-Fatores Positivos
Online com amigo.
Arte do jogo é legal.
Modo arcade online é bem divertido.


-Fatores Negativos
Depois da primeira cidade o jogo fica lento, lento para upar, para achar novos equipamentos e etc, o mapa é muito pequeno e não há muita exploração, por isso voce fica muito tempo num lugar e acaba achando chato.

Alguns inimigos são chatos demais, não tem dificuldade real e sim chatisse mesmo. Alguns chefes são desafiadores outros fracos e outros chatos. Variedade de inimigos não é boa.

Depois da dungeon 2, você vê que o jogo não pode te oferecer mais nada de diferente, praticamente voce ja tem o equipamento suficiente pra chegar no fim do jogo, o level praticamente suficiente pra chegar no fim do jogo, assim o jogo se torna chato.


Considerações finais.

O jogo diverte nas primeiras horas sem dúvidas, se voce conseguir um ou dois amigos pra jogar online e jogar no hard a história, acho que pode ser mais divertido. Mas realmente falta alguma coisa nesse jogo.

I've been playing the beta non stop for around 2 days now, and I've got to say that I am very impressed. It has all the charm of older RPG's like 'Legend of Zelda- The Minish Cap' but with a multitude its own little flourishes. The story line (so far) has kept me interested, and the side quests aren't just dull fodder. 

It took me a a short while to get used to navigating the large menu, and I wish I could banish my pet to the farm (not the metaphor) instead of just "hiding" it. 

Sometimes the graphics makes it hard to distinguish what is background art and what is moveable or collectable items, especially when first starting, but it doesn't take long to become used to it.

Altogether I think it's a fantastic game, although I am very biased towards that particular RPG style its a real throw-back to old school gameboy games. I will definitely be getting the fully completed version and I'm glad that the developers are taking their time to make the most out of this game. I hope that the game run time isn't too short in its entirety but from how long the developers are taking, I'm sure these fears are unfounded.

What I didn't:

29197123.review:
치명적 버그 발견 --;; 스킬 퀵슬롯 창에 Rebind 라고 있는데 그걸 건들게 되면 
kan / kana 로 바뀌면서 해당 키는 영영 못씀.. 해결 할려 해도 알 수가 없음... 
메인 메뉴로 나와서 키보드 설정을 해도 키 설정이 안됌.
그러다가 Z버튼 키로 옮겨지면서 게임만 실행되고 선택 자체를 못하게 되는 상황 발생..
난 지금 이 게임을 못하게 됐음. 
그 동안 했던 세이브 파일 다 날리고 새로 초기화 해야 해결될 듯 보입니다.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
재미있고 중간중간 기발한 구석이 있는 게임이며 
아직 미완성 이지만 정가를 주고 즐겨도 아깝지 않을 정도로 성의가 보이는 게임.

플레이 난이도도 어느정도 괜찮고 보스 전투 패턴들도 단조롭지 않고 짜증나게 만드는 것도 없어서 보스 전투할 때 제일 재밌었다.
하지만 제일 아쉬운게 한글화란 점이고, 캐릭터 원화는 별로 호감이 안간다. 
스킬 사용도 아직은 밸런스가 맞지않아 쓰는 것만 쓴다.

스킬들도 5렙이상부터는 골드 포인트를 사용하게 되는데 
레벨업 때마다 주는게 아니여서 전부 스킬 10렙 만들 수 없다는 점도 좀 아쉽다. 

그리고 버그 인지 모르겠는데 스토리 진행 때 초록슬라임 모자랑, 호박머리 카드는 아무리 때려잡아도 안준다.
버그라 의심될 정도로 드랍율이 최악인 게 부분 존재함.(초반 토끼가 주는 악세서리도 오지게 안나옴.)

전체적으로 단점 보다는 장점이 많은 게임으로 많은 사람들이 했으면 하는 게임이다.
앞으로 많은 패치 되면서 업적이나 컬렉션등 숨은 요소들을 찾는 컨텐츠들도 더 나올껄로 기대된다.

28923834.review:
这游戏对于我来说真的是很棒呐!
  首先，游戏画面虽然是低像素，但是看起来很美观舒畅，也不像有些像素游戏，玩着有些模糊不清的那种感觉。
  其次，主动被动技能花样很多，技能特效做得很棒，技能等级越高，特效越华丽。使游戏富有了很高的耐玩性和美观性。
  同时，游戏很好的结合了剧情和地图，有啥样的剧情就有啥样的地图，应景嘛!
  剧情的特点是我最喜欢的一点，因为游戏里NPC的话语真的很幽默哈哈哈～并且2D头像做得超棒啊，（一想起那个袋子的懵B表情我就笑个不停）
  地图开发的可以显现出作者群的脑洞实在是太大了，浮空城和泰明的相位移动和时空穿梭、山洞的推符文石块和反射镜块什么的，真的很费脑细胞啊～虽然这一点也许成为了很多玩家厌烦的地方，但是我觉得，有这些难度也无伤大雅～除此之外，地图上有些宝箱和阻隔的场地，也得费些脑力进去，里面可能有很棒的道具，也为游戏增添了难度和可玩性～
  说到缺点嘛，有些小瑕疵。
  首先就是:等级升级相比较有些龟慢。希望作者把升级机制稍微改一下下，也许就不让玩家那么累了。
  其次便是:游戏的装备道具的种类有些少，可以在更新的同时添加些东西。
  Secrets of Grindea. 对于RPG爱好者来说，不入正实在是可惜～所以，我推荐这款游戏，很不错，真的。
  最后最重要的一点我要说，更新更新更新UPDATE！233
------还有几句话，送给每个评论的玩家---------
  也许我们都在游戏评测里见到过因为更新慢或者语言问题而差评的情况，而在这儿我要表明一下自己的观点。一款游戏，我们评测的本意是根据它本身的可玩程度而决定它的优劣，而不是因为某些客观的原因影响了自己的娱乐而直接去决定它的优劣。设计一个游戏，难。创作一个游戏，更难。我们要除了要以主观去体验游戏，也要多一点客观的看问题的意识。不要因为这些原因而让那些好游戏被评为差游戏。

28897212.review:
偶然的一次机会吧，我室友在玩这款游戏，乍一看感觉挺平常的，应该没什么难度。因为我平常比较喜欢3A大作，所以一开始对这款游戏不太感冒。但是我尝试了一下这个游戏，发现远非我所想。这个游戏的剧情还是挺棒的，技能系统简直点赞，你可以随意搭配，单手剑士，魔法师，魔剑士等等你可以自己随你的意愿来搭配，可玩性挺高的。一直认为自己不属于手残的那一类，并且以前认为这种2D的游戏会有什么难度，会难过血源黑魂吗？然而我错了，在困难模式下从天空之城的BOSS开始就有点打不过了，满屏的弹幕简直让你无所遁从，所以想要体验一下剧情的玩家还是选择普通难度吧。
好了说了这么多优点，再来说一说缺点吧，这款游戏的作者据说只有一个人，自然开发更新速度也是慢的可怕。并且武器系统做的只能说是一般，种类偏少，在到达一定等级之后没有能更新的装备，有些技能偏鸡肋，几乎没人点。流程算有点短吧，因为还在研发中吗，这也无可厚非。里面有一种模式叫做挑战模式，玩多了会觉得疲倦，感觉需要在改进一下，嗯就这么多了。
游戏质量还是挺高的，喜欢像素风PG的玩家赶紧入手吧。

The game is a good game, me and my little brother had quite a bit of fun fighting the bosses and dying. The story is okay as well, with the gameplay just like The Legend of Zelda mixed with Sword of Mana it really takes a ease on the rpg style. I also love the collection of monster cards and items. 28705567.review:
[h1]良い点[/h1]
・クオリティの高いドット

・スタンダードでとっつき易いアクション

・作業感がなくやり応えのあるレベルデザイン
ステージの道中にはパズルギミックも多く、ただ敵を倒していくだけの単調な作業にならないような工夫が為されている
ボスにも明確なコンセプトが見受けられ、強い敵を試行錯誤で攻略していく面白さ、そして倒したときの達成感は突出したものがある

・アーケードモードにおけるやり込み要素
アーケードモードはかなり難易度が高い上、ランキングも実装されているのでやり応えがある
これだけで一つのゲームとしてもいいくらい完成度が高い


[h1]賛否両論[/h1]
・良くも悪くもレールが敷かれてしまっている
ゲーム性としてはRPGよりもむしろアクションの方に重きを置いているように感じた
というのも、キャラクターのレベルは進行度によってかなり厳密に管理されており、ボスが強いから雑魚でレベル上げをしよう、というRPGの基本がこのゲームには通用しない
ボスはとにかく回数を重ねて徐々に攻略していくしかないため、レベリングのような作業が好きだという人には微妙かもしれない
逆に試行錯誤の攻略が好きだという人にとってはかなりプラスに働く点だろう


[h1]悪い点[/h1]
・キャラクター育成にあまり幅がない
職業などの縛りはなくスキルを自由に取得していく育成システムだが、スキルの強弱はやはりある
物理と魔法のハイブリッドを可能にするようなスキルも多数あるが、現状はどちらかに特化した方が明らかに強いように思われる
この辺りのバランス調整は今後期待するところだ


総評としては、見下ろし型の2Dアクションゲームが好きな人なら買って損はしないと言える
更新は速くはないが、公式ブログでは週刊の作業報告もされているため気長に待とう

28642171.review:
Holy what in the hell....yeah, this game is full of charm, the Grinding in Grindea isnt actually that bad, and grinding for tons of collectibles is fun! the battle is tight, with a few minor things and the graphics, the design, heck, even the missions that have depth to it, all of these components are really awesome and this game,. even in early access, is starting to already shape up as one of the better rpg games that ive played this year.

TL;DR: This game is AWESOME! you like nostalgic zelda-like exploration games, but with more customization, collecting and crafting, really fun skill progression, abilities that vary greatly, and enemies that are designed smartly and with a challenge???  Then buy this game!

Graphics: alright, its a top down 32 bit looking game. and man, do they do a wonderful job at making sure every pixel counts, and every animation is fluid! The graphics are nostalgic, and they are done well

Sound: Man, the music is really suited for an adventure game. i really was not diaaposinted by the music at all, very well done. the sound effects were plenty, and they had depth and actual weight and distinction to each move you make. Of course, its nothing too fancy, but its not done poorly, they made every sword swing, every fireball, and every crate breaking sound good

Gameplay: Man, I am very impressed with the combat. its quick, its fluid, the enemies variety are very challenging and require to think about how to approach each one, ESPECIALLY WHEN THEY START WORKING TOGETHER AND F*** YOU UP!! oh man, there were some parts where i was sincerely triggered cause i couldn't get past some enemies when i really wanted to blow through a part of the stage to complete my mission. I played this on the hard difficulty, so im sure that why they were much more difficult to kill. Anyways, what everyone will definitley enjoy about how the combat is done is by the way you character is...

Customization: Yes, this game is very customization friendly! You want to go nothing but tank? well choose the corresponding stats to boost you defense significantly, dump your points into two handing that tree bracnh you get when you first start out, and sponge away the many slimes presented, all the way until youre three hours deep into the pumpkin forest, trying to hack away at ghosts that keep friggin disappearing in front of your face, and even though you know thats not the way to kill them, youre already soo hellbent on getting the last hack on his ectoplasmic butt, because your a tank, with the brain of the sponge, and YOU DONT KNOW ANYTHING ELSE!!!..... But, if you do have a moment of awreness, you could totally respec you're guy on the fly! you can totally dump those pointe that went into tanking into something like a snow buddy. A cute little snowball dude who's totally loyal to the cause. And hey, why stop theree? You can throw your invstment into four different magic categories, earth, fire, ice,. and wind! And best belieive that your armor, and your clothes are customizable too! I REALLY appreciate the developers for going this route, AWESOME!

Look, im gonna stop here and give you fair warning. As of this review, there are somethings that are still locked in the skill tree, because they are still indevelopment. Which leads me to one of the biggest troubles of this game. THERE IS LITERALLY NO HEALING. the only way to heal, is to pick up healt orbs from enemies (which drop pretty frequently), go back to town, or lvl up. Nopne of this was really an issue......until you start fighting bosses. OHHHHHHH man, this is the biggest flaw of this game.

HOW THE HELL DO I BEAT THE DAMN BOSSES THAT ARE OP, WITH NOT A SINGLE HEALING POTION OR SKILL!!!!

This, my dear developer, is THE MOST infuriating thing in the game, I pray to the flying spaghetti monster that you include something, cause this has got me beyond vexed. And the only other thing i gotta complain is the way blckin is handled, it seems real unforgiving, and even a bit unresposive at times. But hopefully, these things will be fixed.

28505957.review:
It's a good game, but I honestly feel that it's extremely overhyped for what it offers--which isn't much.  

I wouldn't really play the game for its story, as it seems pretty basic and I didn't find there to be much character depth.  It does try and it does give you some background to the characters and features a nice "cinematic" of the player's mom (which is actually really awesome because they made it so that her hair+skin color is the same as whatever you chose for yourself).  But that's more of a game feature than something specifically story related--the story itself, like I said is pretty stereotypical.  Some people might like it, but after playing so many games, it just feels repetitive--if this was an mmo, you wouldn't even bother reading it.

The combat has some nice elements (though I do remember being a bit frustrated with a few things--sorry, it's been over a year since I played this, so I can't remember the details very much) and the art is cute enough that I would like to continue playing it, but since the game is unfinished at the moment, my only options are to play Arcade Mode or to grind for cards.  I don't really want to grind for cards when their website's forum FAQ states there may be a potential wipe when the game is finished.  Maybe this has changed, but even so it feels odd to grind for something you may never use.

The problem isn't that the game is unfinished--we knew that going into EA, but what we didn't know until after we had completed all there is to do was that it's been in development since 2011 and is still only about 30% to completion.  The description on Steam with the link to the devblog in bold paints the picture that development is constant and EA will soon be over, but this doesn't seem to hold true.  

Many of the areas in the game that you try to go to will give you a little notification that it's not yet implemented.  (Also on this, if you try to go to another map and you're cooping, you will be denied access unless all party members are at standing on top of you--just a heads up for those who might be bothered by this.)  As is, I think there are about 10 or so hours of content in storymode.  
 
On top of this, if you notice the Discussion Page on Steam features a locked sticky entitled, "Haven't played in over a year..." where in the last post, the developer states, "New threads will be locked, and if the same user keeps creating new ones we're going to assume they're just rabble rousing and we'll use the dusty ol' ban hammer that's mostly sitting in the corner."  



Which boils down to: You are not allowed to mention the slow development.  Ever.  




I don't know... I just don't think that kind of censorship is exactly right.

Additionally, the website's FAQ states that they are not looking for additional people to help with the project and all positions are filled, so while they say things are slow because they only have three people to work on the game, they're not actively trying to remedy that, despite people offering to help.  

I checked out the latest post on the devblog again, and one of the things that was written, "Definitely looking forward to another year of fun gamedev, and I hope you’ll all stay with us through our journey!" doesn't sound too hopeful that the game will be finished next year, either.  

Again, though, I'm not trying to say the game itself is bad; it's just that... there's not much there.  I'm really sad to leave this with a negative review, but I just cannot comprehend how these issues seem to be so overwhelmingly glossed over.  

We bought this game over a year ago and keep checking back only to feel really discouraged; fifteen dollars is a lot for someone to spend on something that doesn't seem to have a lot of hope at the moment and I just don't want anyone to be put in a situation where they end up disappointed.

If the game is ever completed, I would probably change my recommendation, but at the moment, I don't think I can recommend it, sorry.

28491684.review:
O game ainda está em desenvolvimento mas vou fazer algumas considerações.

[h1] A História. [/h1]
A história é cheia de humor, envolvente e curiosa, muito bem desenvolvida por sinal, você fica com vontade de conversar com cada NPC, eles são cheios de personalidade. Não pretendo dar spoilers aqui, pode confiar, se você curte um bom rpg com história esse é um dos melhores que eu já joguei.
[spoiler] Eu disse que não daria spoilers...[/spoiler]

[h1] Jogabilidade.  [/h1]
Eu utilizo um controle de xbox, não testei no teclado mas já ouvi reclamações, na dúvida jogue o Demo antes, mas caso tenha um controle pode comprar sem medo, X ataca, A defende, Y e B você usa como hotkey de habilidade, LT e RT mudam os esquemas do XBYA pra que você acesse outras habilidades, basicamente no controle você tem 3 esquemas de hotkey, o principal (sem segurar LT ou RT) onde consta fixo o ataque no X e a defesa no A, sendo o Y e B configuráveis, o LT onde eu particularmente coloco feitiços de invocação, o RT onde eu coloco demais feitiços ou items consumíveis e key items. No mais o jogo é bem funcional.

[h1] Combate.  [/h1] O modo NORMAL do game é hard, mesmo um mobzinho simples pode te dar de cabeça, [spoiler] Eu estou falando de você abelhinha [/spoiler] é preciso ficar atento aos timings, utilizar a defesa sempre e se esquivar dos golpes, os BOSSES são incríveis e pode ser difícil matar de primeira, mas uma vez que você entende o padrão se torna uma tarefa simples... Brincadeira, continua difícil. Existem diversos upgrades de habilidades que são: Combate (uma mão e duas mãos); Magia (fogo, gelo, vento e terra) [spoiler] cuidado para não chamar o Capitão Planeta sem querer [/spoiler]; Suporte (basicamente defesa); Passivas (gerais, combate e magia). 

[h1] Arte.  [/h1] 
Linda. Sem palavras, as animações, as sprites, as cutscenes, perfeito.

[h1] Considerações Finais.  [/h1] 
Ansioso com o lançamento oficial do game, novos conteúdos, o jogo é lindo, ainda que no Beta é possível ver o potencial. 

[spoiler] É, eu sei, spoilers everywhere [/spoiler]

RECOMENDADO.
11/10

28482659.review:
Great game with lots to do, good story, and a good variety of skills and spells. If you're a fan of old school action RPGs, you NEED to play this one. Because people seem to like these things:

Pros:
- Good gameplay with solid, customisable controls.
- Lots of items, armour, and weapons.
- Gameplay is very flexible. You can play whatever kind of character you want, and you'll be able to win any fight as long as you practice.
- If you decide you don't like your character's direction, you can just grind for cash and buy back your skill & talent points.
- Well written story & dialogue.

Cons:
- Some parts are missing, and that's kind of disappointing.
- I feel like some bosses & enemies need to be scaled down a bit, and others need to be a little tougher.
- I'd like to see more acheivements, because I like getting acheivements.
- Most of the music is a 15-30 second loop for most areas. While it's well composed, its too short and gets repetitive.

This is the first early access game I've bought, and all in all, I'm happy with it. Other early access developers should take notes.

28426519.review:
This game is one of the [b]BEST[/b] examples of retro RPGS.

This game features plenty of the classic RPG tropes.
[list]
[*] Basic tutorials that is satired in order to make it more tolerable
[*] In-game character customization.
[*] A leveling up your character while breaking everything in sight for loose change and other objects
[/list]

Despite this, [i]Secrets of Grindea[/i] actually feels more original than most Retro RPGs I've played.
To me, it's strengths lie in three specific categories.
[olist]
[*] Combat
[*] Story
[*] Overall design
[/olist]

[b]COMBAT[/b]
Aside from customizing your own character which on it's own is a lot of fun, you can actually use upgrade points to learn special skills such as one-handed weapon attacks, spells and powerups. The best thing is the are absolutely NO restrictions on what you can learn.
Wanna wield a two-handed sword while unleashing fire and electricity at your enemies? Go right ahead! There's no stopping you.
Also, the combat in and of itself is extremely fun as well.
Dungeon bosses are all unique and require a lot of thinking most of the time and timing. Not that menotenous "hit it till it dies" stuff you get from other RPGs.

[b]Story[/b]
Now, the story (while simple), is actually easy to follow. You're the son of a collecter, a sort of Ranger who works to find rare and exotic artifacts for study and to better human society. Upon graduation, you're given your own "companion", Bag. Bag works as sort of the parody equivalent of Navi, except instead of giving you useful tips most of the time, you get tips when you lose, making it much more tolerable. He's also more mean-spirited and rude, which I find more entertaining, yet annoying at the same time.
It also pays homage to some of the classic games: Legend of Zelda, Dragon Quest, etc.

[b]Overall Design[/b]
This is one of the most beautiful Retro RPGs I've ever seen. The design of the land is 10 times prettier you could make in any RPG maker and the character designs used for conversation are great as well. The dungeon designs are the cherry on top. You're forced to use your brain for a lot of the puzzles you come across and beating them just feels so rewarding.

Final verdict: This is a GREAT game for people who love the old fashion styled games. 9.5/10 Download the demo, and you won't be disappointed.

28332279.review:
First thing i would like to note, that at this current stage, the games storyline and area's are still being developed. And the development progress is in small and sometimes slow doses between updates. For me personally, i have stopped playing til the game is complete so my experiance is not lost by the partial development.
With that in mind, do not let that put you off from purchasing the game. It will be one great experience once complete, and even between.

Meanwhile, until the game is fully developed, you can optionally beta test and help the developers stamp out any nasty issue's found, make suggestions towards the development via the games forum found upon their site, or simply play the addictive Arcade mode. Or perhaps you just dont mind playing the game in partial installments.

"Grind"ea? True to it's name, there is some grinding involved here and there, though it is done and balanced rather well.

I Love the detail that has been put into this "JRP Zelda type". From the artwork, to the gameplay details such as the skill system. Finding a game of this type with such TLC from the developers (also explains the slow rate of developement), that also supports cooperative multiplayer.. is just rare.

One thing that the store descriptions fails to mention, is the existance of the crafting system (Unless that is a part of the "hidden content").
Weapons, gear etc can be crafted from various ingredients found throughout the game.

There is not much else i can tell you, apart from what the store page describes. So ill finish this with a personal rating..
9/10 - Would buy it again.. and again. I Love this game, and i love it's ever promising future.

28322696.review:
Man, if you're looking forward to a small RPG to play with your friends, this is it.

Secrets of Grindea creates a small and old-fashioned RPG environment with pixels and adorable sprites, exciting gameplay, and an interesting storyline. The customization in this game is great, you can create different builds revolving around different skills and passives. Although shadow clone melee is the best build, you can try something else that's interesting, like picking up a magic class and mastering different elements. You can have around like 4+ characters that are saved to your own profile, so feel free to test out some wonky builds or follow a generic build!

Keep in mind, this game is still in development, and gets better from here on!
Not to mention, you can host servers by just a click of a button.

28187599.review:
(Current review is for version .710a

SUMMARY:  A love letter, homage, and parody of classic Nintndo-style action RPGS filled with features, character and customization.  Must-support and must-buy for fans of classic action-RPG and crafting.  Even in Early Access, it's impressive.

Let's get the bad out of the way - this game is Early access, and as of mid 2017 I don't expect it to be finished at least until year's end.  That being said, if you love top-down action RPGs with crafting, you probably should be supporting this anyway, but if you want, read my review.

Secrets of Grindea manages a difficult job.  It is a love letter to classic top-down button-mashing action RPGs Nintendo was famous for, but also packs in the "best" features of many games.  It is an homage to all those games, without limiting itself.  Finally it's a parody that's not mocking, but affectionate - and the parody elements even work into the plot.

The best comparisons I've found are Dungeonmans and Starbound, games that took their time, knew their subject, evolved, and turned into something amazing.

In the game, you are a young Collector in the world of Grindea, your aim is to collect artifacts and equipment.  The game offers:
* Highly customizable skills.  You can focus on two kinds of weapons, four kinds of magic, and support skills.  You can also tweak "talents" that affect how abilities and skills function together.  Each of these abilities can also be leveled up, improving and changing how they work.  Build a combat maniac who mashes stuff with a hammer, a summoner surrounded by friends, a dashing and dodging ninja.  It's up to you.
* Simple but effective crafting with depth.  Find enough stuff, make stuff is how it goes, but you'll need to explore and experiment to discover what unknown ingredients are needed.  Fortunately things you encounter that can be used are specially tagged.
* Choose your equipment. Weapons, hats, armor, accessories, and more all affect how your character functions. Power up your magic with a sorcerous chapeau, find boots that speed up your movement while you charge skills, or stick a pumpkin on your head. You can also choose items to be "cosmetic," changing appearance while you benefit from an equipped item.
* Plenty of quests and sidequests and extras.  There's always something to do in Grindea, with plenty of rewards.  Don't forget to return to people you've talked to before.
* The fun of the grind.  If you want to max out your equipment, you're going to mash monsters. Grindea, however, makes it fun, with ways to increase spawns, meet tougher monsters, or refight bosses.  You can even tweak skills and equipment for maximum, fast grind. Farming is actually fun!
* Lots to do.  Go fishing. Raise a pet. Find minigames.  Look for hidden treasure. Up your hat collection with Mister Fabulous. Grindea offers you many things to do depending on goals and mood.
* Your own expandable house.  Have fun building your own domicile as a break from adenturing.
* A great visual style. The world's classic-cartoony not-quite-anime look is charming and appealing, the monsters have personality, the settings are colorful.
* A great soundtrack. There's a classic game soundtrack here that sets the mood and is excellently composed.
* Story and humor.  There's plenty of humor and an actual story (with some great twists) that's not all laughs. The game comes to life as well as making you laugh - then punches you in the gut with pathos.
* Two game modes.  You've got your usual adventure, but also the roguelike random adventure mode that lets you gradually build a character legacy and a town!  It's literally two games in one.
* Optional co-op. On top of everything else, play with friends.

Sound like a lot?  The game's staff also consists of three people as of this writing. It's pretty amazing what they've done since 2011.

Just a reminder as of this writing it's early access.  The game is very fun, there's lots to do, but it's not done.

Now who should get this if you're willing to go Early Access?
* If you love old-school AARPGs you probably should just pick it up now to enjoy it and give feedback.
* If you love looting and crafting and hunting up rare things and playing minigames, get it.
* If the above review interested you.  This game hits a special sweet spot, it just "fits" some people.

I picked it up and figured I'd check it out due to curiosity.  I played it for 2 hours before realizing how deep in I'd gotten.

That might be the best reccomendation I can make.
