I also love the fact that your characters and their skill sets are completely customizable, making the game an ever changing adventure for the players.  I played as a battle summoner, as well as a mage. :D  Another thing I love about it is that you can use a keyboard or gamepad which for me made things a lot easier.  This game is well suited for a gamepad.  The only complaint that I have is that I wish they would get more content out there for us so I can play the rest of the game. :)   I don't mind playing the rogue-like arcade mode, but would much rather finish the storyline within the game.  Been wanting to do an online run with some people and make some new friends so feel free to add me if you want to. Overall I would give the game 4.5 stars out 5 rating.  Once the game is finished I more than likely with give it a 5 out of 5. Great Job Devs, and keep up the good work.

19445425.review:
I agree with many other reviewers beneath me in that Grindea is an engaging, bugless and smooth rpg that has a definite MMORPG feel with the optional rare items farming that I find incredibly relaxing. 

Pros - 

*Excellent 2-D graphics without being pixelated as seems to be the norm lately.
*Responsive easy to learn controls that forgive mistakes but only to a point.
*Crafting system makes even weak monsters seem worth killing.
*Boss fights are genuinely epic and satisfying.

Cons - 

*Crafting system starts out promising but the lack of items to make in later levels makes it feel gimmicky instead.
*Lack of weapons in general makes battles feel too repetitive after awhile.
*Replay value somewhat hindered in storymode by the increasing costs of changing your talent points, sometimes requiring 30 minutes to an hour of farming to try something new.


All in all I'd say for an early access game this is terrific and if the developers could fix the above issues and perhaps double what is already in the beginning stages...It would be a good I would be willing to pay 40+ dollars for. It feels like an offline MMORPG with Zelda-esque vibes. Great game for relaxing and listening to tunes. I pray it gets better from here.

19349757.review: It's a zelda-eqse play-with-your-friends 8 bit RPG + an additional mode where you can play it as a roguelike with your friends. It's incredibily polished and the combat system is well refined and requires more timing and depth than other games of the same genre. While some of the ways to beat the bosses are cliche, this is not necessarily a downside because they are splendidly executed. Furthermore, there are a fair amount of bosses whose patterns/attacks the developers have taken creative liberty to make unique, unexpected, and enjoyably difficult. Characters are not class bound; rather each character has a limited number of usuable skill points and the same pool of skills they can choose from. This allows for multiple unique playthroughs on both story and arcade (roguelike) mode. I haven't found a similar game that brings forth the amount of depth, polish and nostalgia that Grindea has.

19215210.review:
Story-wise, it's nothing special. The story is well-written, funny at times, but ultimately nothing that will win any prizes. 
Action-wise, it's nothing special. Combat systems and skill trees reminiscient of soo many other games of the same kind.
Visuals are not really anything special either. Everything is cute and well-made, like in so many other games of the same kind.

But you know what? It's engaging, it's fast-paced, it's completely glitch-free and smooth, and most importantly it supports multiplayer through Steam. It's both a relaxing and fast-paced Action RPG that I can definitely recommend that you enjoy with a friend or two. Not to mention it is still in Early Access, which means there's lots of content to still come.

So far, this game is extremely well-made and polished, and definitely something you can sink some time into, alone or not; though the multiplayer aspect was ultimately what made me buy it. I haven't tried the arcade mode yet, but I already feel I've seen enough of this game to recommend it dearly.

19140854.review:
Okay, so my time says 2.2 hours, mostly for the case because it does'nt count offline time... BUT i still think being that i've gotten pretty dang far, i think i should have a say, before i start, these are simply my pros and cons upon the game, you like them, great! if not, well prefernaces are preferances! now let's get started!

Pros:
-Old fashion RPG style, i think it's refreshing to see old styles coming back, not lazily done either, this was actually made as such with care, sure it's a work in progress or "Early Access", BUT so far, can't complain too much about the game style.
-graphic style, i'm not usually one for 2d pixle style unless it's either done well, or turns out like terraria, where the gameplay makes up for it (My opinion... besides, you can make you're own texture packs for terraria anyways...), but game however, has done it correctly in my opinion, given it that charm that i don't get from most games now a days.
-skills, sure alot of them are'nt that "Uniqe", but they are pretty good, concidering you can dash foward and damage anything in the way? or leap back and slash foward? i can't complain that much!
-Cards, this is actually better then you may think, No it's not part of a card game, but their permanent boost to a certain stat, or additional damage or special ability, plenty a pain to gain, but pretty good otherwise.
-Crafting, not much at the moment, but i can see this going pretty well if done well.
-Costume slot, Has to be said, considering i can have a full plate helm and still look like i just have glasses on, basically making my own appearance in the game? gotta say, THIS i really like...
-Pets, Gotta say, i like pet's as is, but just having a jack o lantern as an option? that won me over for that detail, but to the real stuff, basically feeding you're pets, you give the xp in a certain stat, once it levels, it gives you a bonus for as long as you have the pet! (Seriosely though, Devs, Great job on the jumpkin pet, Love it, Love it, LOVE, IT...)

now the cons (Note: i don't have too many because the rest are mostly one nuetrals):
-YES the game is very grind-ish at times, gaining materials, certain armors, weapons, I'm just placing this here because even I have to admit that this CAN get mind numbing, BUT take note: This one is least concerning, why? The word "Grind" is in the title, so really... well that IS what you're getting a peice of... but to be fair, you don't HAVE to grind to get through the story, again, don't pay TOO much attention to this one.

Now the Nuetrals:
_Custimization: Yes i do like the costume feature, and yes i can basically make myself in real rife... for the most part, still missing facial hair, but we are playing as a young child... my point in this one is, Yes it's there, just not much of it is there at this time, which the reason it's a nuetral? "Early access" is why.
-Armor, and when i say this one, i mostly mean chest armor appearance, basxically... it never changes, no form of changing it accept colors, i guess you could say this is SORT of a request, but a deal breaker by any means, Just a small request to let us change from simple shirt and scarf to say leather or metal armor? to appropriate to the class? robesx for mages, leather for rogues, metal for tanks? mostly for appearance, like in costumes...
-Difficulty, i don't mean for the common enemies, i just mean for certain bosses it CAN be rather... unforgiving... until you find some form of work around or loopole to the boss...

That's about it really, again, the game is early access, so not TOO much can be said upon it quite yet, it does look promising so far, heck, if i had friends or people to play with, or someone to help get through the story, i'de go for i9t to be honest, but any ways,  at the current time, i would give this game... 7.5/10 seem fair? for it's current status, this is in no way the final grade, but yeah for those who just want a charming, nice, Mostly friendly game to play, i recommend this plenty!

19103876.review:
Ich kann das Spiel absolut empfehlen!

..ja, es befindet sich momentan noch in der Beta und das merkt man schon, da es eben ein noch unvollständiges Spiel ist. Aber dieses RPG vereint vieles, was man in anderen Spielen oft vermisst hat. Bspw. die Bewegungsgeschwindigkeit ist sehr angenehm; der Schild ist wesentlich nützlicher als zB. in Zelda; Ausgeprägter Skillbaum mit der Möglichkeit sich auf Melee, Mage oder Support festzulegen, oder aber auch auf eine Mischung daraus. Wobei man sich aber auch verskillen kann, wie ich gemerkt habe. Kein Problem: einfach ein bischen Gold farmen und schon kann man Skillpunkte einzeln zurücksetzen. Quests gibt es bei Vollendung hoffentlich wesentlich mehr! Waren mir nun doch etwas zuwenig, allerdings trotzdem nettausgedachte. Die Umgebung ist schön gestaltet, besonders die Pumpkin-Woods gefallen mir sehr.

Jetzt aber zu den Gegnern und Bossen: Die Bosse sind mit jedem Mal mehr herausfordernder. Hier gilt es besondere Achtsamkeit auf das Ausweichen zu legen. Weckt aufjedenfall den Ehrgeiz dran zu bleiben. Die Angriffe sind nämlich mit einem vertical-shooter vergleichbar und dementsprechend schon anspruchsvoll. Aber hat man die nötige Konzentration, schafft man das. Und wie gesagt, es weckt den Ehrgeiz und das mag ich besonders an Spielen. 
Was die gewöhnlichen Monster angeht: Auch hier waren die Entwickler sehr kreativ! Alle haben verschiedene Verhaltens- und Angriffsmuster. Es wiederholt sich nichts. Und hin und wieder trifft man auch auf eine Eliteform von einem Monstertyp, der dann etwas ausgeprägtere Angriffe hat. Dafür aber auch bessere Drops!

Menü: Im Spiel sowie im Menü gibt es sehr viel zu entdecken. Man kann beispielsweise ein Monster mit gewissen Items zähmen und auch füttern und sich somit Passive Buffs/Effekte verschaffen. Weiter kann man im Spiel sogar Karten von Monstern bekommen, die ebenso einen permanenten Effekt haben. Das Craften habe ich jetzt noch nicht ausprobiert, aber auch das ist bisher in kleinem Umfang möglich.

Ich hoffe sehr, dass dieses Spiel bei weitem größer wird und die Entwickler weiterhin mit Herzblut am Ball bleiben.

MfG

19072853.review:
Game is amazing. It plays like a Legend of Zelda/Terranigma sort of classic ARPG. The story and characters aren't super compelling, but are good enough to keep you involved in the game and not detract from the gameplay. Your talking item bag sidekick is great, though. The music is amazing. The combat system and level-up systems are great, there's a lot of customizability for how you choose to play the game. Lots of the options for combat have great synergy between them, and there are no class restrictions to skills, creating a sort of mix-and-match build system that feels really fun.

The only negative disclaimer is that the game definitely isn't finished yet. The content runs out 5-7 hours into the game right now, smack in the middle of the plot. If unfinished content isn't your thing, I would recommend waiting for the game to be completed before buying.

18689914.review: I love this game! I really like its pixellated art style and its level system! Its level system is especially great because of its distribution of normal and gold skill points, basically to level skills (which I may add arent limited to a certain class you can choose any skill or spell regardless!) you need to get skill points but eventually once the skill is a high enough level normal skill points wont work and you need to use golden points to make the skill stronger these golden skill points are much more infrequent than normal skill points this provides a way of making it so that you dont get super strong super fast giving you a much more challenging aspect. Another great aspect of the grame is its great side activities! You can fish, tame pets do fun sidequests, herd chickens, and craft strong weapons and armor! I love the crafting system its simple but still needs a fair amount of grinding for certain items, which is great because its well IN THE NAME and it gives you great satisfaction when you finally craft the item! One of the only complaints I'd have about the game is it only lets you play with steam friends which is ok i geuss but I'd like to be able to play with people online I could make new friends with, not neccesarily for story mode but more for arcade mode, which i may add is a little cruel. Other than what i have already stated I have no complaints I really look forward too the games further development in which something I hope to see is a skill line for the bow and different kinds of bows like there are swords, another thing I REALLY HOPE TO SEEEE is healing! while I understand enemies drop health from time to time I feel health potions would be very useful and would bring more attention to the potions shop in Evergrind, another thing regarding healing I hope to see in the game is a healing skill for the support skill line I personally would really like this because healing teamate would make the game a lot more fun with friends. I hope you find this review helpful and if the developers are reading this I hope they find my ideas helpful

If you have a friend you really like playing with online, I really cant say anything else than WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? This game is wonderful, the combat is beautiful, the music is awesome, and the humour put into it actually wants you to read the text and kinda follow the plot, I was really sceptic to this game when we started and then you start to get the feel of the game.

The combat is very satisfying, especially with controller, I havent tried with mouse and keyboard, but with controller everything is smooth and awesome. If you want something to play by yourself or with up to 4 friends , thats smooth, fun, challanging, and awesome, then this is the perfect game, and its not that expensive. 18623237.review:
Excellent action rpg. Like a cross between Ys and Zelda. Very good gameplay 10/10. The combat mechanics are very well thought out, many enemies cooperate and you have to plan your attacks accordingly. Bosses will make your heart race, some of them reminds a bit of bullet hell shooters. Animations are very nicely done, music is good. Story seems pretty standard for this kind of game so far, not exactly Chrono Trigger level, but its engaging enough to want to know what happens next and theres lots of funny moments. Theres a simple fishing minigame, mainly for providing food to your pets, who gives different permanent buffs depending on what you feed them, and some not so hard puzzles. 

I dunno how much of the game (story mode) is finished atm, mabye 1/4? (hope its less :p ) The content that is in the game seems 100% done and everything is working great, very polished, unlike most early access games... Didnt notice any bugs. As of now theres about 10-12 hours worth of the main game (mabye a bit less if you play on normal and just blaze through) + xx hours of arcade mode, wich is a sort of semi random series of "rooms" where you try to get as far as possible before you die while building up your character on the way, and get your high score in the global ranking, great fun. Havent tried it in co-op mode yet so cant comment on that. 

I can confidently recomend this to anyone, any age, who likes this sort of game. Its a good challenge on hard. Again, the combat gameplay is great, you have to time it right and use the shield, reflect projectiles and know when to go all out and when to hold back. Truly a gem in the making.

Secrets of Grindea ทำให้เราชวนนีกถึกเกมส์แนว Old-school rpg อารมณ์เก่าๆ อย่าง Secret of Mana หรือ The Legend of Zelda เป็นเกมส์ที่ชวนให้ย้อนวันวานของเหล่าผู้ที่เกิดใน Gen Y หลายๆคนอาจจะชอบกัน 

ตัวเกมส์เป็นสไตล์ RPG มุมมองด้านข้างแบบดั้งเดิมเลย ภาพน่ารักใสๆ มีเกมเพลย์ สองโหมด ให้เราได้เลือกเล่นก็คือ Story mode กับ Arcade mode ที่เอาไว้แก้เบื่อในช่วงเล่นเกมส์เคลียร์ไปแล้ว ซึ่งเราสามารถเล่นแบบ Multiplayer ได้ด้วยนะ เราจะพูดถึงใน Story mode ก่อน ซึ่งเริ่มมาสามารถเลือก Create ตัวละครได้อย่างอิสระ และในส่วนของ Ability เราก็เลือกเล่นได้อย่างอิสระเช่นกัน คือสามารถเล่น Melee + Magic หรือจะเลือกเล่นเดียวๆก็ได้ ละก็มีระบบ Craft item ที่ใช้ของดรอปทั่วๆไปมาคราฟได้ด้วย ในส่วนของ Arcade mode เป็นแบบเล่นผ่านด่านไปเรื่อยๆ ก็เอาไว้เล่นแก้เบื่อนั้นแหละ 

ตัวเกมส์ยังเป็น Early access ซึ่งน่าจะยังอยู่ไปแบบยาวๆ ขอบอกก่อนว่าเกมส์นี้พัฒนานานมาก เราแนะนำให้รอถ้าไม่ได้อยากจะเล่นจริงๆ เพราะมันยังไม่เสร็จ เล่นไม่กี่ชั่วโมงก็จบแล้ว อาจจะไม่คุ้มเท่าไหร่ถ้าจะในซื้อราคาเต็ม แนะนำให้ยัด wishlist ไปยาวๆแล้วรอลดดีกว่า

18533497.review:
This game, to put it simply, is amazing. The animations are smooth, the storyline is enticing, and the combat, surprisingly, is quite interactive. 

The ability to pick and choose whichever skills you want with no restrictions really allows you to create your OWN character. There is no "optimal" skill set, you just find the one that works for you. The game is extremley challenging on HARD mode, requiring players to strategize on every single fight; giving you a great feeling of satisfaction after clearing a room. Speaking of feelings, the gameplay intertwined with the storyline does an outstanding job at provoking feeling within you. Satisfaction, anger, happiness, confidence, sorrow; it's all there. Of course the game isn't complete, but I am sure that upoin completion the game will take players on an emotional rollercoaster, which will leave you saying "damn, that was a great game"

The developers constantly update their blog, so that players aren't waiting for new on new content for extended periods of time. They've even bothered to include special dialouge which will let you know when you have reach the end of the stable/ frontline beta (for the time being). And, of course, there are plenty of witty comments that you can sense took time and effort from the team.

Pros: Everything
Cons: Not complete yet

I'd have to say, aside from some very slight bugs (which I am sure they will fix) this game deserves a 10/10. 

If you're looking for a game with classic graphics and modern mechanics, this is the game for you. Buy it. You will NOT regret it.

18465813.review:
This game is what I've been missing since the advent of the Nintendo 64 and Playstation.  A quality, amusing, fun, multiplayer RPG that lets you be who you want to be and play with your friends.  A lot of the game is simple enough to pick up, while other aspects seem frustratingly incomprehensible (at first).

The Good:[list]
[*]Can choose the colors of your character's clothes and hair to stand out from other players
[*]Can change your character's hairstyle to stand out as well
[*]Can not only equip masks to look different, but can equip a "style" for masks, weapons, and shields, to allow your character to look a certain way without sacrificing the stats on their gear.  Major props to the developers for that mechanic.
[*]Humor.  This game has plenty of it.
[*]Active developers who read their forums and respond to feedback.  They not only tell you what they're doing every week, they show images and animated gifs that prove it's not just hot air.
[*]Experience Cap - You can avoid outleveling your friends by hunting in areas that are beneath you, so you get money and items but no XP.
[*]Arcade Mode - A randomly generated series of rooms that let you play a character with your friends and work toward the development of a town.
[*]Puzzles - The Temple of Seasons especially.  The use of seasons to not only affect the monsters' abilities, but also affect what can be done with the room, is amazingly well done.  Some of the other puzzles (like the bells) require a little attention to detail to figure out.  includes puzzle-related humor as well.
[*]Fishing - Because fish!  Ok, because it's a free way to get pet food, and the time investment doesn't make it feel cheaty for the return.
[*]Pets! - Because pets!  They don't fight for you, but you can increase your stats by feeding your pets certain items/fish.  The more they level the more food it will take, so you may wish to devote specific pets to specific traits.
[/list]

The Not-so-Good:[list]
[*]Characters only ever have one clothing style, regardless of colors.  Perhaps my character wants to run around in robes, while my brother's wants to run around in a martial arts outfit like the monks in Evergrind.  What if my friend's female character wants to wer a dress, impractical as they are for adventuring?  Male or female, you only get one (the same) set of clothes.
[*]Small development team - While not really a bad thing, it does make the updates take a lot longer.  I applaud their desire to keep with a stable core that isn't going to lose interest and disappear during a project, but at the same time I wish they could produce updates just a little faster.  The forums show multiple offers of assistance, which are politely declined.
[*]Arcade Mode - Every time you die, you start over at level 1.  This doesn't make for a "grind" as much as a monotonous loop of re-leveling and trying to get back to where you had been.  While being too weak in the story mode allows you to backtrack and level, or hunt cards, the Arcade Mode forces you to keep moving into progressively more dangerous territory, and one bad spawn can reset you to zero instead of just backing off and leveling some more.
[*]Equipment limitations - With a good drop on one of the bosses you can have one of the best 1-h weapons in the current release of the game, halfway into Story Mode.  Most caster gear is functionally limited until far into the second temple, while you can get great melee armor and weapons throughout.  Even buying all gear and dropping/crafting all
armors as of the end of the current release, some of the most useful caster gear was either available 1/3 of the way into the game (MP regen robes) or at the end of current content (temple loot/drops).
[*]Monster Cards - While I do believe they are awesome and useful, I feel the benefits they grant are so powerful in some cases that you become reliant on them, rather than simply empowered by them.  To change them now might require some major balance tweaks, but Bloomo and Pecko are the two that spring to mind.  Without them I stood little chance alone in the Temple of Seasons against the mini-boss, after XP slowed to a crawl.  It seems awkward relying on those to beat a few fights...  Later in the game, unless more high-HP boosting cards are added to balance tough fights, I could see them being less useful.  For now though, they're pretty much a necessity.
[*]Economy - It never really seems like you have to worry about money in this game.  By the time I stopped hunting all the cards and mob drops, I had enough money to raise my Jumpkin to level 10 purely off potions.  Buying anything else was like picking out pocket lint, for all the impact it made in my savings.[/list]

I believe that the game has incredible potential, and is great fun as it stands now.  I've put in 41.2 hours as of the time of this writing, and most if it is in Story Mode.  I probably won't be gaining much on my play time until they release more, but I keep checking the devblog every week for updates.

Pixel Ferrets, I salute your game.  Keep at it.

18338017.review: Lots of potential. I honestly think now that this game will never be finished. It has good game play, but considering this has been in "early access" for three years almost, I think this game will be finished in about another decade. Frankly, this is a five dollar game in it's current form, and considering that I have owned it for two years, and it's not even half finished, is incredibly disappointing. The game is done well, gameplay is good, and it's a fun casual RPG that speaks to times when good RPGs were still being made. Another game that embraces SNES nostalgia is Stardew Valley. Stardew Valley is a game made by a single person, and it hit the shelves complete, intricate, and incredibly well made and thought out. This game has multiple programmers, and despite it being a great idea, there is just not nearly enough content at this point to warrant a whole 15 dollars. Save your money. If you are looking for some SNES nostalgia, get Stardew Valley, it's not at all the same game, but it shows what is possible for a single programmer to achieve with dedication and diligence. I waited two years to inch a tiny bit closer to a story I really wanted to see unfold, only to realize, at this rate it will be another ten years before I will ever see any kind of conclusion. I love the idea, and I really like this game, but should you spend 15 dollars on it? No. At this point we should have a finished game, not 42% of one.

18214298.review:
So, I bought this game and played it for 6 hours straight.

18214225.review:
So. I got this game because it was cheap, and looked kinda fun. Well, I was not really expecting to be too amused, the game looked kinda low Q and corny.

6 hours later i nthe same sitting, I realized I had not eaten anything, nor had a bathroom break. Well, it was a little late.

10/10 would sit in shit again.

Now for a more serious review. 


This game is 15 bucks at the time of this review. 

I have spent 30 on games that were NOT EVEN CLOSE to as good. I mean, after 20 minutes the game is already throwing you into a deep and fun story. after an hour you have already laughed your ass off more than once, and the game does a damned good job of not taking itself to serious.

For an "ARPG" with great elements from zelda, secrets of mana, and God knows what else lies ahead, it plays any RPG fan into a lifetime of fun. The game excessively reminds you it's about the grind that RPGs generally have, yet you don't feel underpowered at all when you rush through something. On the flip side - it forces you to go back and grind because you feel like you are missing something if you don't.


Pros --

-Great Storyline
-HOURS of content in a tiny little package
-Devs clearly care about the game because it gets constant attention
-Has parodies of all types of games (no spoilers)
-YOU CAN FISH
-Side story is still amazing, even in alpha/Early Access stages
-Character options are not limited. You can be a mage, tank, DPS, or all, or a mix of whatever. 
-YOU CAN FISH!
-Fishing has rewards
-Fish have a purpose
-Fish have multiple purposes
-Fishing is seriously fun in this game
-FISH
-I see a ton of replay value

CONS ----

-No timer letting you know you have been playing for 6 and a half friggin hours straight.
-Seriously, I can't find any cons for this game, and that scares me.




Overall, this game is amazing.

Graphics - 9.5/10 - They are amazing, a great homage to classic gaming.
Sound - 9/10 - Some sound effects are a bit overbearing at times, and if you drop the volume you miss out on the little effects.
Music - 10/10 - Great score. The entire game has music that keeps you going. At no point did I dislike it a bit. I almost didn't even notice myself humming to it all the time.
Gameplay - 10/10 - The gameplay is perfect. For it's genre and subs, it has all of the elements in the right place. PLUS you have so much freedom in character creation.
Controls - 9/10 - Id give it a ten, but sometimes the placement of things feels a little off. May be a bit better after you get used to it more I guess. Nothing is actually bad about them, but personally I miss keys from time to time when I need to chain things together. 

Overall, this game has a solid and simple 9.75/10. I mena, just buy it. You wont regret it a bit. They creators have done an amazing job, and I can't wait till this game is complete, and a sequal is in the works.

18125017.review:
I've been waiting for a game like this for YEARS.

Zelda/ Ys meets Castlevania, with a story like something out of SNES-era JRPGs.

Grindea doesn't take itself too seriously, but really hits home with amazing sprite animations, exeptionally tight and ballanced gameplay, a loot/crafting system that makes you actually want to collect things you don't need, and a simple, yet complex level up system that honestly doesn't feel like any I've seen before, and to top it off, it's got a killer hard mode (arcade mode) that reminds me why I suck at rouguelikes, yet for some reason keep coming back to them!

Oh, AND it's got a great coop system! My gf and I look for fun coop games pretty frequently, and we're often dissapointed. Not this time! Great weekend gaming/ veg session!

The only gripe I have, is that since it's early access, the adventure content is incomplete. It took the two of us about 14 hours to "complete" the story at 100%. Arcade mode had more stuff, but was a little too punshing for us to experiment much.  I need the rest of that story!

Seriously. Buy this game. At full price.

18112915.review:
Played this game with 2 friends, story mode on hard difficulty was definitely challenging, especially some of the boss fights require multiple attempts, forcing you to learn the patterns instead of just smashing buttons.

Some of the level design reminds me of Legend of Zelda, combat brought back memories of Secret of Mana and brutal (but fair) boss design could be compared to games like Ys.

The game has "grind" in its name so if you're a fan of hunting for items, it certainly has that aspect aswell. There's really no reason to grind if you don't feel like it. The grinding aspect works well though, the longer you stay in one area and the more enemies you kill, the faster they start spawning with some of them being stronger "elite" versions of normal enemies. So the difficulty starts ramping up and it can get pretty chaotic after a short while.

Lots of fun with friends, just be aware that it is early access - not all of the game zones or skills are implemented but the core gameplay and mechanics are solid already.

We've yet to finish the story mode and we haven't tried arcade mode yet. But I can already recommend it, atleast as a co-op game if you're fans of ARPGs.

18081807.review:
Secrets of Grindea ist ein wirklich tolles Spiel!

Das Team setzt viele Vorschläge der Community um und fragt auch regelmäßig nach weiteren Ideen oder Meinungen zu unterschiedlichen Möglichkeiten der Weiterentwicklung. Auch im persönlichen Kontakt, den ich hatte, nachdem ich meine Mithilfe bei der Lokalisierung angeboten hatte, war unfassbar freundlich offenherzig. Wirklich ein tolles Team!

Der aktuelle Umfang des Spiels ist für einen netten, ausgiebigen Nachmittag ausreichend, aber ja auch noch nicht abschließend für das Spiel. Die Ideen, die umgesetzt wurden sind optisch und spielerisch sehr ansprechend und stellenweise auch sehr fordernd. Die Anlehnungen an bekannte Spiele und Ideen von ihnen, finden sich an vielen Ecken und bereichern das Ganze viel mehr, als das sie stören würden. Es gibt viele kleine Geheimnisse, die schon jetzt immer wieder für ein Schmunzeln sorgen und dem Spieler zeigen, dass hier besonders auf Details wert gelegt wurde.

Ich kann das Spiel jedem empfehlen, der gerne ein schön gestaltetes, Retro-Spiel mit Innovationen aus allen Ecken der Gaming-Szene spielen möchte und die Weiterenwicklung eines kleinen und gelungenen Hits beobachten will.

I don't really know how to describe this game other than, "Strangely Satisfying".

Yes this game is all about grinding (sort of self-evident by the title) but the grinding is actually pretty fun, You get a really wide range of attacks and abilities to use so you can really customize your combat style to your preferences. The game does unfortunately seem to be lacking a little bit in terms of character customization, but that's not a terribly bad thing, just something I wish would be improved upon. In fact I'd even say this game sort of handles like some of the old-school The Legend of Zelda games, except with more RPG elements to it. Plus, as someone who generally couldn't care less for dialogue, the dialogue in this game is actually pretty good. I actually laughed at a few parts and rarely found myself skipping through dialogue. Not to mention I think it's pretty clear the devs have some real passion for this game. You can really see all the hard work, love & care that went into this game.

The only downside is that updates are unbelievably slow and infrequent.

I can't really think of anything else to add that might convince people, but seriously, just buy it. I'm almost certain that if you're already interested, you'll enjoy it. However if you know this isn't your kind of game, why are you even here?

17958371.review:
High quality action rpg fun with a lot of nostalgia tossed in aswell. There really isn't enough I can say about this game, the multiplayer is crafted perfectly, with drop in/out features enemy difficulty increasing with each additional player not just increases in attributes but additional skills for bosses etc. 

Very indepth character leveling, allows you to create and mold your hero as you please, so you can find your perfect build. The story mode is probably about 50 percent complete, by the time i reached the end i was really yearning for more. There are tons of collectibles and several mini games including pets. Perfect game for the kind of person that loves additional content after the story, especially those who enjoy some grinding.

For those tired of playing in the story, there is a very well crafted arcade mode that is of course also multiplayer and has almost infinite replayability. 

The real seller with this game though is the combat, which takes you back to old school SNES 2D top-down games like Link to the past and Secrets of Mana, but it is so much more then that. Once you find a build you enjoy whether you're just sitting back grinding enemies or facing the highest difficulty challenges, time just flies by.

As you can tell I highly recommend this game. There is a demo available which definitely gives you enough of a taste of the game to understand my high praise.

17796735.review:
EA Summary: Really polished encounters, controls, and a ton of fun.  Currently low on content (about 6-7 hours to do all main quests and side quests).  While I recommend this game, it is NOT worth $15 at this stage (9/1/2015).

Detailed Pro's: 

The encounters (11/10!) in this game are incredibly well tuned and the clear highlight of this game.  There's no healing that I'm aware of, which means you will be challenged to learn each of these encounters as you die many, many times, similar to Super Meatboy or Dark Souls.  Like Meatboy, you will respawn instantly, and like dark souls, being greedy never pays off; slow and steady wins the race.  

The world is also quite nice with beautiful pixel graphics.  I would describe the dialogue as 14-year-old humor that harps on many RPG tropes.  The writers clearly have a sense of humor, which is nice.  The (side)quests are about a 4/10, really only designed to have you revisit old areas.  Some of them have unique bosses, those are cool.

The gameplay is also about 8/10, very tight controls.  I really only played 2H with a few extra spells, but the game will allow you to play archer, sword n board, 2h, or a mage in any/all of 4 magic schools.  Plus, there are support spells that help both melee and caster.  The spells seem really weak at low level but quite good once "leveled up."  Points can be re-allocated for gold, which is great because you can try something for a price.  

Cons: Not much content yet, but it is still a solid stable and polished beta build.  If they keep creating more of the same, this game will be a fantastic modern version of its predecessors like Secret of Mana/Evermore, Link 2 tha Past and others.

17745486.review:
(This review is based solely on the Story mode)
This is an extremely promising 2D ARPG early access game that I absolutely adore. It is by no means close to being finished but it has an incredibly solid foundation. The first thing I need to mention is the art style is phenomenal and the game has one of my favorite soundtracks of any game out there. As I'm writing this review, my character is in the Flying Fortress just so I can listen to the music. The music gives me Final Fantasy vibes that I love. Let me also mention that the art in this game is awesome. The game is full of color and it's a beautiful game to look at.

In terms of gameplay, there are many choices to be made. There are skill sets for 1H or 2H weapons and the magic is divided into fire, ice, earth, and air (which should be called lightning...). There are no classes so you can mix and match between all of these sets (For example, you can be a 2H user that also specializes in ice spells. If you freeze an enemy, you are guarenteed your next physical attack to crit). 

So far, there are 2 dungeons in the game that both have very strong themes and art styles. There is not a single part of this game I dread going through. I loved Tales of Symphonia but I HATED some of those dungeons/temples (especially the sewers, oh god). Let me also mention that the second dungeon has a mechanic involving changing seasons that I have never seen before in any game. Watching the whole room change colors is quite the thing to see. My only issue with the dungeons are that they are too short. I WANT MORE.

-There are 6 notable bosses in this game and they are all designed very well each offering very different strategies to conquer them.
-Each type of enemy has a small chance to drop a card which gives your character small permanent bonuses (5% discount at shops, Atk/MAtk/Def buffs, AtkSpd and CastSpd buffs, etc)
-"Farming" is very easy in this game. If you kill a group of enemies, stick around for about 2 more minutes fighting enemies and the spawn rate at that location will increase like crazy. There's a room in the toy factory that will spawn endless amounts of presents for you to kill repeatedly. I probably did it for a solid 30-45 minutes and it was great!
-This game also features Arcade mode which is essentially a rogue-like version of the game. It's pretty darn hard but fun I suppose. I haven't played it enough for the purpose of this review though.

I'm looking forward to seeing more updates for this game. Not sure if you want to buy it yet? No biggie, PLAY THE DEMO! 
Thanks for reading! I will update this review once more updates come out.

17740149.review:
**This review is coming from a pure single-player experience** (there is multiplayer)
I have done all of the story mode content there is to do at this time, minus collectibles, as of version 0.600amigo.

Pros:
-Fun combat, lots of skills and perks. You can respec for a doable in-game fee. Smooth and fluid animation.
-Multiplayer, which I did not try out. This can be done in the story mode and arcade mode.
-The environments are awesome, the character artwork could be better, and the music is good, but nothing I see myself humming to.
-Many cameos from other video games. Zelda, RE4, Honeydew, to name a few.
-There's a stable version and a "frontline" version. Pretty self explanatory. The latter has more frequent updates (every few weeks) the former every month or two, from my understanding.

Cons:
-The amount of monsters you have to kill and the many hours it takes to get a drop does not line up with an items rarity most of the time. It is not unheard of to spend 4-8 hours killing the same monster all to get a drop that is probably not better than what you already have JUST so you can work towards 100% completion. This is never a requirement, but the cards you can get in particular offer small permanent bonuses, and it can take you anywhere from 30 minutes to 8 hours to find the one that you want.
-It's short. But the game's not done yet. The current story can be done in about 4-6 hours. Getting collectibles could get you another 10-20 hours, depending on your luck. Question is, do you want those mostly mediocre drops bad enough to spend all that time?
-Arcade mode as a single player is quite a challenge. I usually opt for the harder options in video games like Kingdom Hearts on Critical but this mode is hard from the get go if you are alone. I would like to see some scaling in difficulty to make it more doable (maybe there already is, and I just suck.) But if you're looking for a challenge, you've got it here. An option to turn down the difficulty would be nice though.

These problems can be easily remedied with time, however. The creators are friendly and interactive with their community, and they post frequent updates.
So the question is, do I recommend this game? Is it worth the current price of $15.00?
Yes it is. For the amount of playtime I got out of it, for the potential of what it can become, and for the multiplayer, which I didn't even touch, which is sure to add many hours. If nothing else, follow this game. Come back to it later. For an avid RPG fan, this is a game to watch out for.

17717676.review:
Really great game! Haven't had an indie production be this fun for a while without it being some sort of sandbox requiring multiplayer to be fun, this game is fun both multiplayer or singleplayer and it works well both ways!
 Although still a little bare bones in some ways(I understand being a small team it must be awful work so i wish you best of luck and maybe you shall get more support in the future) and in need of some balancing on difficulty and melee damage also leveling up and crafting gathering mechanics being a bit of work and keeping yourself healed can be harsh with waves of mobs gets frustrating after an hour, it's still i have to say quite an experience worth to try in early acess, with a friend it makes it even more fun, get a copy for them or invite them to get one if it's possible! This really feels like a game that needs immense support, i tried to buy a more expensive bundle sadly my ways of payment cut me off that, such a shame i couldn't get the soundtrack but let me continue on this to say why this game is amazing.

 It brought me back to this feeling of playing a game fresh and new for the first time i doubt i'll ever forget, simple but quite entertaining battle mechanics and a neat little skill system with melee, support and magic to choose from, fighting so much enemies though with little health recovery and waves of enemies is a bit of work though, 2-handed melee users be aware. 
 The dungeons and puzzles are also quite something, typpical Zelda stuff but still feels like an achievement to go trought them and both so far are amazing and unique! All packed with fitting enemies for the the zones and the bosses, oh boy, they're work to fight against a few continues i had to go trought for the first main one, but the battle was still so memorable, even mid-bosses are have the same impact!
 World building, design and characters, maybe a little bit of work one could do on the world, it's beautiful i have to say the scenery is amazing already for starting areas and the animation of the sprites is so fluid and nice to the eyes and the colors all mesh well but sometimes things can get a little cluttered and confusing especially on a certain double boss. The second temple is amazing and in my opinion so original i couldn't wait to see it before having seen some of the screenshots before purchase. Now characters, i have longed to see characters with so much life has these, everyone has a distinct personality even so with some stereotypes there is still amusing dialogue and memorable scenes and goodness the sidekick is probably one of the greatest characters i can't just wait to see what he has to say next.

Should you buy it while it's still in early beta? Absolutely! This is a worthy beta to play if you want this game to be finished so please please support Secrets of Grindea!

17614341.review:
PERMANENT BETA
PERMANENT BETA
Yesterday Planetary Annihilation released a standalone game that completely replaces their older product. The game was successfully Kickstarted and went through Early Access where it attracted endless negative reviews; missing features, promises that weren't kept and deadlines that weren't met. The cynical among us might suggest a completely new product means a fresh slate for Steam reviews - but it's a damning indictment of a company's misuse of Early Access.

It's a shame because, for the most part, Early Access has been a phenomenon, allowing games to grow and developers to get real feedback on what's working and what isn't and make changes based on those player responses. Secrets of Grindea has recently hit the Early Access scene and, after a successful demo launch earlier in the year, stands out as a shining example of development done right.

Secrets of Grindea is a 2D RPG in the vein of the older Zelda or 'Of Mana' titles. it has the same charming art style but has a quality of animation that gives the whole game a modern feel, that unfortunately doesn't translate especially well into screenshots. The game focuses on a young boy leaving his village to become a man (stop me if you've heard this one before) and to do so he must first collect his sword and shield and make his way to the nearest town.

On the way you'll learn the basics of combat and get a real feel for how exceptionally well animated Secrets of Grindea is. The sway of a cloak as you dash, the hunched shoulders of a defensive position and the theatrical swirl as human enemies pirouette to the ground in defeat.

The premise of the game is, aside from killing and leveling up, that you are a collector. A type of champion who's tasked with chronicling and cataloging things within Grindea's gorgeous and vibrant world. There's a hint of Pokemon about it all, but Secrets of Grindea wears its influences proudly; and why not? This is an excellent reimagining of some classic ideas and franchises.

The levelling up system itself is more reminiscent of Diablo than any other franchise. As you level up you get skill points which you can put into various areas; magic, defense, skills etc You can unlock new, castable abilities which subsequent points will improve, or level up several of your passive skills. It's adequate, though I'm yet to come across a level up system that I could ever describe as anything other.

I've finished all the content available in Secrets of Grindea's Early Access build outside of the game's Arcade Mode which I'll delve into when the full release arrives. As it stands, though, I would have no reservations about recommending Secrets of Grindea to anyone. It's been a while since a game has been so whimsical, light-hearted and, as simple as it sounds, fun. It's gorgeous, colourful with a stellar soundtrack and is more than an homage to 16 bit classics. This is a faithful re-imagining of the tropes of old with a modern shine and it does it so much better than everyone else. 

http://www.permanent-beta.net/previews/2015/8/19/early-access-investigations-secrets-of-grindea

ローグライク好きにぜひプレイして欲しい！

ストーリーモード、ドットデザインなど素晴らしい点はたくさんありますが
このゲームの面白いところは何よりもアーケードモードです
このアーケードモードがいわゆるRogue-likeに近いもので、非常に歯ごたえがあります

アーケードモードは全12フロアあるランダム生成されるステージを攻略し、クリア、ハイスコアを目指します
一つのフロアは部屋ごとに分かれていて、 モンスター部屋（大多数はこれ）、チャレンジ部屋、宝箱部屋、アイテムショップなどを経て
ボス部屋を目指し、ボスを倒したらそのフロアはクリアです
初期状態は毎回同じ装備（ほぼ裸）のレベル1から始まり、そこからアイテムを集め、レベルアップをし、スキルポイントを振り分けながら進めていきます

これだけだとよくありそうなゲームモードなのですが、優れているのは非常に洗練されているということです

・武器は短剣、長剣、ロッドの3種類で、それぞれの立ち回りがある
・スキルは約50種類あり、様々な戦い方が試せる上、非常にバランスが良くてこれが最強というものがない
（個人の配信を見ても、それぞれ違う戦い方をしている）
・敵の強さはストーリーモードのハード相当、最初は死にまくるが徐々にコツが掴める
（基本はヒットアンドアウェイでノーダメ。初クリアは早くて30時間）
・実績が超鬼畜なのにいつか取れる気がする。取りたい
（8月14日現在アーケードモードの実績の約半分が取得率0.3%以下）
・ランダム生成でアイテムドロップもランダムだが運の要素は低く、実力がないとなんともならない
・1～4人のマルチプレイが可能で、ラグがなく難易度も人数相当に上がっていく
（ランキングは人数ごとにわかれている）


ボスなどに最初は苦戦するが、慣れるとパターン化できていく感じはダークソウルなどに通じる部分もあると思います
現時点でwikiが充実していなかったり、アーケードモードのプレイヤーが少なかったりで、面白さの割に認知されてないなと思います
定価で買ってもisaacとか好きな人はきっと後悔しません。ぜひ一緒にハイスコアを競いましょう

10/10 I can't wait to see it finished

17480556.review:
Zelda meets Terraria.

At least, that's how I'd view it.  The graphics are very good and well animated (for a 3 person team, from what I've heard!).  But that's probably not what you want to hear; you probably want to hear about the gameplay.

The attacks are very satisfying, going up two types of charges: silver and gold.  And if you don't like your build, you can use money to reset it, which is very nice.  You're not restricted by classes either, so you can switch freely.  What's better than hitting the (current) last dungeon and ohko'ing everything with your 2h weapon and a crit build?  Probably a billion dollars but if I'm trying to convince you to buy this game, you probably don't have a billion dollars.  Sorry.

The story is quirky and cute, and the puzzles are pretty easy so it's not hard to get by the story.  The references are great too.  And if the story's not enough for you, but you don't want to do arcade mode, there's always the grind (for loot and cards)!

Arcade mode is quite a challenge (at least for me and my trio of inept friends.  Oh god, the bees) but it's fun and so far seeing the perks and trying to get town upgrades motivates me to keep trying. (We've made it to the second floor.  A true display of skill.)

However, some things I'm not so keen on, such as:

- Bows.  Do you even really need them? (except for that one area that I won't spoil)  I was doing 1.1k+ damage with a 2h weapon on a crit, but only 255 damage on an arrow crit.  Not to mention that the ammo is limited.  I would like for there be a more traditional ranged weapon class, so I'm hoping that later editions will introduce stronger bows, perhaps.

- For some reason the hair stylist sometimes glitches out and the previews of the hair icons are all glitched.

- Leveling pets is a bigger grind than I thought it'd be, but it's probably because higher level food drops haven't been implemented yet (I'm hoping.  Oh god 1000 apples no why).

- Marino needs to be stopped.  I hope the devs write in a side quest for this.  Thanks.

- CHICKEN HERDING

I'm very much looking forward to future updates and the full release of the game!  And if you're still interested, but on the fence, try out the free demo!

17459381.review:
[i]Even though this is in Early Access, it is quite polished. Not a bug in sight, and there is plenty of game to sink your teeth into here.[/i] I was leary of the price, but its definately worth it. This is a throw-back to some great games of fairly long ago. I definately feel some heavy [i]SNES Zelda[/i] and [i]Secret of Mana[/i] vibes here. Like those, it also has some fairly heavy MetroidVania elements where you will be backtracking through the open world to access areas you previously couldn't. 

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Great artwork.
+Great feel to it - it plays really well. Controller support and rebindability is great in this title.
+Music is fitting to this style, and is not generic - it is its own thing.
+Awesome level of RPG character customizability.
+Loads of quests even now. I love the treasure maps. Lots of sidequests, and they are all well done.
+Even though the light 'grinding' humor is there - the game never really feels that grindy (ironically enough lol).
+I love when the characters clothes/hair/etc. is customizable and changes with changing items.
+Storyline is well written - I am not skipping through it yet ;)

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Online multi is awesome but I really wish they would add local so I don't have to purchase a second copy for my wife to play.
-[i]Hurry up and finish the unfinished zones already :D !!![/i]

If this sounds like something you would like - I guarantee you will not be disapointed with this even in Early Access.

17371426.review:
Secrets of Grindea is incredibly fun! I absolutely love co-op RPGs, and this ARPG has potential. It has a Secret of Mana/A Link to the Past vibe, and after trying out the free demo, I immediately bought it. While the game is still in early access, there is plenty to do. Once you run though the story (as far as you can, it's still in development), there are likely still items to craft, a pet to level to increase your stats, and an arcade mode that is challenging and addictive. As of right now, the game has controller support for a wired 360 controller, and you can use software to bind buttons of other controllers to specific keys, so you can make different controllers work (I'm using the PS4 controller) - the game feels great with a controller, so it's definitely worth doing if the keyboard set-up just isn't working for you.

I strongly recommend at least trying the free demo - as there's nothing to lose. It's a relatively small download, and while  you could probably rush through pretty quickly, if you take your time to explore and take things in a little, you'll get a decent amount of content for a demo. The demo can also be played cooperatively, so it's probably worth trying to get a friend or two (or three, if you can) to try it with you!

17363287.review:
[h1]This review is based on the game in its current state at the time of posting and is completely my opinion. Yours may differ to mine. I also only really played the story mode and did co-op.[/h1]

Secrets of Grindea is an action RPG with a major focus on the story and meticulous detail worked into its environments and graphics.

I just completed everything in the Secrets of Grindea that is currently available in the version out at this time and I have to say that what they have so far is fan-bloody-tastic.

[b]Things I liked[/b]
[list]
    [*]Fantastic pixel graphics with fluid animations that make me say "wow" in some circumstances
    [*]An interesting story with creative sidequests and lovely characters
    [*]Hats and lots of them. I'm a Team Fortress 2 man and I found the choice of hats to be most adequate.
    [*]The plethora of references. I won't spoil any of them, but they're there.
    [*]The soundtrack consisted of fantastic tracks that all matched their locations in game. Not a single track sounded out of place in this game.
[/list]

[b]Things I didn't like all that much[/b]
[list]
    [*]The story was a bit short. But that can be attributed to the fact that it's in early access.
    [*]The limited supply of weapons available was quite disheartening as I found myself wielding the most powerful one-handed sword in the game about 1/2 of the way through the story with not much choice on what else to use.
    [*]Player customzation is unfortunately incredibly limited with the only changable things being colour of clothing, hair style, hats, and facewear. I found myself yearning for a dress but was sadly stuck with my adventurers outfit. I don't want efficieny, damn it, I want to look fabulous!
[/list]

Overall after I played through and 100% completed the game with a mate of mine we both left with a feeling of satisfaction and the desire to one day return to Grindea when more content is released. What I'm trying to say is [i]buy the game already. It's worth it.[/i]

17360337.review: Secrets of Grindea is a game I have been looking forward to since I saw it on steam greenlight years ago. This game harkens back to a simpler gaming era; a time where the games had story, very fun fighting mechanics and a sense of completion and fulfillment. A few minor bugs here and there, considering it's still in its baby beta stage and maybe a few issues with enemies being overpowered in their crow control on players. This game is everything I've been wanting out of games today and just haven't been getting. As a future video game designer, Secrets of Grindea has the formula I've been looking for and want to perfect in making a game. I've gotten well over $15 worth of enjoyment out of this game and it's not even fully done yet. Hats off to the developers. 10/10

2015/8/2現在でのレビュー
ストーリーをハードで１周した感想

SFC時代によくあったトップビュータイプのアクションRPG
成長に関してはレベルアップで得たポイントを各スキルに割り振って育成していくタイプ
クラフト、ペット、アイテム図鑑に釣りなど、その他の要素も満載です

キャラデザは一度全てやり直していますが、それでもまだ濃い目
まあこれはこれで味があっていいとは思いますｗ

現在言語は英語オンリーですが
「意志をもった危険なアーティファクト達が起こす事件を解決しながら世界の謎に迫る」
というわかりやすいストーリーなので、英語が苦手でもわりと入って行きやすいのではないかと思います
随所に他作品のパロディーもあり、なかなか楽しいです

私がハードモードを選択したせいもあるんですが、このタイプのアクションRPGにしてはアクション性が非常に高く歯ごたえたっぷりでした
戦闘においてジャストガードが非常に重要で、使いこなせなければ最初のボスにすら苦戦するような高難易度
いやぁ・・・これは実に良い！　個人的にこういうゲームを遊びたかった！
強力なボスに３時間足止め食らったりとかもうたまらんです

というわけですのでアクションが得意でない人は素直にノーマルモードを選択しましょう
いきなりハードモードは非常に人を選びます

ストーリー、ローグライクどちらのモードでもマルチプレイが可能ですが
現在はまともなロビーがなく、IP指定かSTEAMでのフレンド指定のみの身内オンリーな状況です
このあたりは今後の改善が望まれます

まだアーリーアクセスの段階ですが
今の段階でもかなり遊べますので、このタイプのアクションが好きな方は一度手を出してみてはいかがでしょうか？

17306370.review:
TL;DR: Buy this game. Many references, fun story and gameplay but tough as nails bosses.

[Some minor spoilers ahead, be warned]
What is good about this game:
- Being able to select the visual appearence of one item while keeping the stats of another if you choose. No longer must you choose between style and function. You want a chicken hat with the protection of an iron helmet? you got it.
- So many references. In my 7 hours I have notices 3 Pokemon references, a Mario reference, multiple Legend of Zelda references, 2 South Park references, a LITERAL Gundam boss, a well-known youtuber cameo in character and probably multiple more that I have missed.
- Funny dialogue and interesting characters.
- Impressive variety of skills to learn and base your playstyle on. (Several elements with 3 spells each plus many one and two handed weapon skills)

What is bad/can be improved:
- Menus are a bit annoying. For example if I want to make something and I lack the items needed, I can see if I have enough of item A, if I need more of item B or if I havent discovered Item C, BUT It will not tell me how much MORE of item B I need, which is a bit annoying. The difference between Silver points, Gold points and Talent orbs could also be explained better. I got a fair way into the game before realising what Talent orbs were and that I could spend them.
- Some of the bosses feel a bit like Bullet Hells, and it can be VERY frustrating having to redo bosses over and over again since you keep dying to an onslaught of attacks on the screen. Maybe this is intended and I'm just not used to the difficulty, but I think if it is impossible to beat a boss with 1hp, you are doing something wrong as the boss is becoming less Skill based and more Luck based (such as the [spoiler]Winter[/spoiler] boss, where he [spoiler]teleports several times and creates multiple ice pillars while launching fists of snow. He can effectively box you in to a point where you end up being hurt by his fist because you cannot move, or by the spikes as you try to avoid said fist[/spoiler]. Or the [spoiler]Present machine where you have 6 presents, multiple bombs falling from the ceiling and several trains moving past[/spoiler]).
- Block mechanics can be improved slightly. I find myself taking damage if I drop my shield after an attack, even if the enemy has moved back or the projectile has vanished.

I have high hopes for this game and hopefully this game is finished into the masterpiece it has the potential to be, and isn't another forgotten Early Access game.

17291364.review:
There will be parallels made to Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past. And this would be a fair comparison. But it's also a much different experience. It introduces more contemporary RPG elements and does so in a fluid way. It's loaded with side quests. The world is more fleshed-out with... flesh. NPC flesh. The skill system feels great, allowing you to build your character as you see fit. Hurl meteors while wielding a big sword? Go for it. Plink at enemies with a bow and arrow while hiding behind a pet? You can do that too.

Aside from gameplay, the art is beautiful. Very colorful, and the atmosphere is top-notch. The sound design is also great, and the music fits the environment, supporting but not distracting from the game.

Despite these good points, this is still early access. I'm enjoying what I've seen so far, and what I've seen is polished, but it will need a lot of content to fulfill the promise I see in it. Whether or not that's delivered on is to be seen. But if it is, I have a feeling it will be one of those gems people will keep playing for years.

17256284.review:
I had pre-ordered this way back when it first started pre-orders. I think this was two years ago? At the time the game only had about an hour of gameplay if you 100% everything. Being a person that understands what early-access is I decided to give the game a while before coming back and trying it again. 

Now the game has evolved quite a bit since I last played. They have added on a few features, and the story is far more progressed... and it's awesome. The combat is fun, the dungeons are very well scripted and planned out, and the bosses are exciting and challenging. I'm happy to say the multiplayer is also very well done. I have spent a few hours playing with my wife with little to no issues (One time she couldn't see a boss for some reason)

One of the neat aspects about Grindea is actually the way grinding works. If you stay in one place and kill things for a bit you will see that enemies will begin to spawn more and more frequently. This allows for quick leveling and farming for items. It also means that grinding gets more challenging in that spot. It is well worth it for more than just leveling, enemies can also drop special cards that give your character permanent stat boosts.

I could go on but I think one would really have to play the game to get a good impression. Luckily they have a demo although I don't know how up to date it is compared to the actual game.

17215182.review:
Admittedly, I went into this game not knowing much about it at all, which is somewhat rare for me in this day and age. I did this because I felt I didn't need to know much about the game, my very first impression from the trailer and a youtube video sold me on the spot. And I can say, roughly 9 hours into the game as of this review, that my first impression was spot on. If you enjoy the classic action RPGs of the 1990's and early 2000's, such as Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past, Illusion of Gaia, or (obviously) Secret of Mana, then this game is for you and is well worth your time, money, and intrigue.

From my perspective, this game offers 4 distinct areas of interest that define the experience:
[list]
[*]Story Mode 
[*]Arcade Mode
[*]Multiplayer
[*]The Progression System (Skills and Talents) 
[/list]
I will be covering all 4, explaining my experiences and impressions of each.

[h1]STORY MODE[/h1]
While a bit lacking in the engaging story aspect, Secret of Grindea's (SoG) Story Mode offers something many RPGs have failed to have for a while now: the elegance of simplicity. Many modern titles have an obsession with creating a novel's worth of narrative. Cutscene after cutscene, wall of text after wall of text, the experience of these titles are moreso about the story and presentation of it than the actual game.

SoG takes the short and simple approach, where it gives enough story and narrative to provide context and motivation, but is spaced well enough where it does not feel like a chore to read through it all (having the option to skip cutscenes helps too). Not to say that the story isn't interesting, though. While simple and somewhat of a parady of other RPGs, many of the characters are likeable in their own right and their clever interactions are both entertaining and humurous. It's clear a lot of heart was put into the devolpment of this game from all of the silly and minor references to other games and characters.

Putting aside the storytelling aspect of SoG, there's quite a bit of content packed into what is currently available (game is still in beta as of this review). From collectables, to crafting, to minigames, puzzles, Zelda-esque dungeons, side quests, arena challenges, and engaging and replayable boss fights, there's a lot to do. But my favorite aspects are the inclusion of a genuinely difficult hard mode that can be toggled on or off at any time and the ability to customize the look of your character in the form of hats and accessories (that override the look of your currently equipped armor).

To review:

Pros:
[list]
[*]Simple but effective narrative
[*]Interesting and humurous dialogue
[*]Plethora of activities, side quests, and minigames
[*]Interesting boss fights
[*]Hard Mode
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*]Game not complete (with no ETA)
[/list]

[h1]ARCADE MODE[/h1]
Arguably, this is where most of your time will go. This mode is SoG's roguelike feature, where you attempt to progress as far as you can through a serious of increasingly challenging rooms and obstacles on a single life. Much in the way of other roguelikes (such as Rogue Legacy), you have the ability the make succeeding runs easier in the form of unlocking perks. These are unlocked via a currency you obtain randomly as a drop and from completing quests and achievments.

The farther you go and the better you do, the more points you will recieve. After each death, your points are tallied up and added to your total score across all games. After certain thresholds have been met, you will revieve rewards, such as cosmetics (hats and accessories), more NPCs to interact with, and more buildings/decorations for your hub. There is also a global leaderboard for the mode, so if you're into that sort of thing you can sate your fancy here.

As for the actual content of the mode, it's challenging but rewarding. Like any other roguelikes, there are a lot of elements of randomness involved. The dungeon layout, challenges in each room, and the loot you get are all up to chance. However, this works as the combat system is based on skill moreso than raw stats. You will get farther in the dungeon because you got better rather than because you got some good luck on your drops. You find that you are excited to get as far as you can as that shows just how much better you got at the game more than anything else.

Pros:
[list]
[*]Unlockable Perks
[*]Achievments
[*]Leaderboard
[*]Replayability
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*]Can have a somewhat harsh learning curve
[*]Can feel repetative at times
[*]Like story mode, not all of the floors are implemented yet.
[/list]

[h1]MULTIPLAYER[/h1]
While I have no personal experience with this feature myself, I have seen examples of this in videos and streams. From what I have seen, multiplayer is fairly smooth and simple to do. Multiplayer is available for both Story Mode and Arcade Mode, so if you have a group of friends you can enjoy all aspects of the game together with up to 4 people.

Be that as it may, it's not perfect. Currently, there is no option to play with your friends locally. You will need to connect to each other through different computers, and each person will need to have a copy. Additionally, it lacks some quality of life functions such as being able to join someone from your friends list. And, as one would expect from online play, there can exist some connection issues and bugs (although I've yet to see any).

Pros:
[list]
[*]Can play with up to 4 people
[*]Can play in both Story Mode and Arcade Mode
[*]Smooth and stable online play
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*]Can have some connection issues and bugs
[*]Lacks QoL polish
[*]No Local Play
[/list]

[h1]SKILLS AND TALENTS[/h1]
An RPG needs to have some form of progression, and SoG does it with it's ability system. What makes this one stand out from the rest is its simplicity and its lack of restrictions. There are no skill trees, no level/stat requirements, you just choose the skills you like and roll with it. And so much is added to this game because of it.

There are a varity of skills that appeal to all forms of play, be it aggressive, defensive, evasive, melee, range, single target, AoE, Burst, DoT, etc. And given the lack of restrictions on obtaining skills, you can create a massive amount of different and interesting builds. Want to be an aggressive and fast melee striker? Go for it. Want to be a long-ranged magic nuker? Sure! Want to combine both melee and magic for a hybrid spellsword? That's cool too.

Additionally, a lot of the skills from different branches work well together. For instance, Static shock is a spell that will do additionally damage very time you hit with a physcial attack. You can restore charges for this skill from using physical skills or doing perfect guards, meaning this skill can be used in all kinds of builds, both offensive and defensive.

While I would argue a need for more skills, the simplicity of the current design is also appealing and useful. While some talents prove to be more useful than others, many of the skills have their uses and can work well given the right circumsances.

In the end, what gives this game a lot of replayability, both in Story Mode and in Arcade Mode, is the progression system and the appeal of trying out new builds and tactics.

Pros:
[list]
[*]Non-restrictive
[*]Skills work well together
[*]Interesting and thoughtful effects
[*]Easy to make and try new builds and tactics
[*]Simple and easy to understand
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*]Some talents not as useful as others
[*]Arguably not enough skills to facilitate variety
[/list]

17197776.review:
액션이 제대로다.
게임을 시작하기 전에는 [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/239070]해머와치[/url] 정도의 게임이려니 생각했지만 칼질 한 번 해 보고 액션성의 차이를 느꼈다.
[url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/239070]해머와치[/url]처럼 액션의 "ㅇ"도 모르는 사람이 만든 것 같은 저급 칼질이 아니라
원더보이2에 가까울 정도로 타격감이 있다.(타격 사운드는 약간 아쉽긴 하다)
몬스터들의 움직임도 단조롭지 않고, 보스들도 개성적이고 공략하는 맛이 있다.

즐길 거리가 많다.
아이템 제작, 펫 포획과 육성, 몬스터 카드 수집, 다양한 퍼즐, 숨겨진 길, 낚시, 보물 지도 탐색 등
곳곳에 할 게 많아서 지루하지 않았다.
그리고 본 게임이 다가 아니고 아케이드 모드라는 것이 있다.
곁다리 같은 게 아니고 본격적으로 새롭게 즐길 수 있을 정돈데 이게 또 꿀.
얼리 액서스라 스토리 진행이 중간에 끊겼는데도 20시간 넘게 놀았기에, 완성됐을 때의 분량은 어떨지 기대된다.

게임을 게임답게 만든 수작.


// 아쉬운 점

대각선 공격이 없음
대각선 방향에 있는 적을 공격할 때 넓게 휘두르는 칼의 끝부분으로 타격하게 되는데
이게 좀 어색하고 자연스럽지 않았다.

공격 방향이 즉각 바뀌지 않는 경우가 있음
어느 한 방향을 연타로 공격하는 도중 다른 방향을 입력하면
새로 입력한 방향이 무시되고 계속 공격하던 방향을 공격한다.
연타 사이에 딜레이가 없으면 방향키 입력이 먹히지 않는 상태인 듯한데,
방향키 입력을 먼저 처리하도록 수정해야 한다.
개발자가 액션에 대해 이해했다고 생각했는데 여기에 신경 쓰지 않았다는 게 약간 의아하다.
내가 영어만 제대로 할 줄 알았다면 이거 하나만큼은 개발자에게 바로 건의했을 것이다.
이와 비슷하게 방향키 선입력이 무시되는 예가 또 있다.
뒤로 빠진 후 대쉬하는 공격 스킬이 있는데 뒤로 빠진 후 전진할 방향을 방향키로 다시 정할 수 있다.
그런데 뒤로 완전히 빠지기 전에는 방향키를 입력해 두었다 해도 무시된다.
반드시 완전히 빠져서 정지한 후에만 방향키 입력을 먹는다.
액션 게임에서 이런 사소한 것들이 조작감에 얼마나 큰 영향을 주는지 느껴본 사람은 알 것이다.

필드 그래픽에 비해 확대된 초상화 얼굴의 질이 떨어짐
약간 아쉬운 정도.

이름 입력 시 방향키랑 겹침
방향 설정을 방향키가 아닌 키로 설정하면 문제가 된다. ex) ASDW

노가다
아이템 제작을 위해서 또는 도감을 채우거나 카드를 수집하기 위해서 전투를 하게 되는데
드롭률이 낮은 탓인지 의미 없는 반복 전투 시간이 길어진다.
게임의 다른 부분이 다 좋았는데 여기서 살짝 불쾌함을 느꼈다.

쾌적하지 못한 양손검
양손검은 휘두르는 속도가 한손검에 비해 느리다. 시원시원하지 못해서 쓰고 싶은 마음이 안 들었다.
0.5초(대충) 동안 제자리에서 칼을 휘두르는 게 얼마나 답답하던지..
이를 해소하려면 공격 시 아주 느린 속도로라도 원하는 방향으로 약간은 이동이 가능하게 해야 한다.
액션 게임에서는 이 "약간"의 차이가 크다.

영어
스토리를 모르겠다.

퍼즐의 난이도
이 게임에 이렇게 어려운 퍼즐이 필요하나 할 정도의 퍼즐이 몇 개 있었다.
그래도 못 풀 정도는 아니라 괜찮다.

8/10

17188732.review:
Review ( as of 7/23/15)
Secrets of Grindea is a great throwback to the ARPG genre and takes heavy influence from a lot of games from the SNES era of RPGs. The game is played from a top-down perspective and combat is done in real-time, comparable to Secret of Mana and 2D Legend of Zelda games. If you like the combat in those games you'll probably enjoy Secrets of Grindea.

The skill and customization options in the game are very unique in how much freedom the game gives you as a player. The game gives you several options as far as play styles, but you can mix and match the skills as you desire and create a unique playstyle and skill set for yourself. You're also given 2 cosmetic item slots for your characters to customize your hat and/or face accessory so that you can look good, but keep the stats of much better items instead.

The Pixel art is great, everything looks vibrant and is very reminiscent of the SNES era, but at the same time has a very modern feel. The Music is fits well, and is exactly what you'd expect from most RPGs. The humor and references are great, if you've played a lot of RPGs, you'll really appreciate the games' dialogue and subtle nods to other franchises.

The Arcade mode adds great replayability to the game by adding a roguelike element in randomly generated areas and starting from the beginning if you die, great for those looking for a challenge and wanting more of the game.

Did I mention the game supports (Online) Multiplayer? It does, this game can be even more fun with friends! You can go through the Story Mode or Arcade together and this only adds to the game's merits. Local Co-Op is currently unsupported unfortunately.

At the time of writing this review, the game is in early access and incomplete and Story Mode is a bit short, but I strongly suggest trying out the demo and trying the game for yourself. If you like it, you'll probably enjoy what the full game offers now and in the future.

17150616.review:
2Dのゼルダの伝説のようなアクションのゲームで、ストーリーモードとアーケードモードがあります。

全体的なシステムとしては、レベルをあげることでスキルポイントを獲得、割り振ることでアクティブスキルやパッシブスキルを得ることができます。お金を使うことでスキルポイントをもどすことができ、振りなおすこともできます。主にこれにより多様性が生まれます。
武器は片手剣、両手剣、魔法の杖がありますが、全て殴るような攻撃です。
片手剣は攻撃速度が速い代わりにダメージが低く、両手剣はダメージが高い代わりに攻撃速度が遅く、魔法の杖は魔法攻撃力が高くなります。
武器や防具などの装備は敵のドロップから得たり、クエストの報酬や宝箱から得ることになります。
また、装備をクラフトすることも可能です。素材の要求数が多いので意図してアイテムを収集しないとクラフトすることはできないですが、性能はよいのでストーリーをすすめる上で有利に働くことでしょう。
装備は能力が反映されるスロットと見た目だけ反映されるスロットがあり、オシャレをすることもも可能です。
ペットはアイテムを与えて育てると、プレイヤーのステータスがあがります。
ある程度ストーリーをすすめるとワープして全体マップ上の各所に移動することができるので移動にだれることはおそらくないでしょう。
ゼルダの伝説のようなパズル要素があり、少し頭を使う必要があります。
ゼルダの伝説のようなユニークなアイテム(フックや爆弾、)は今のところないので、そこはご注意を。

また、マルチプレイがストーリーモード、アーケードモードの両方ですることが可能です。

ストーリーモードはβということで完結はしていません。テキストは全て英文ですが、重要なこと(固有名詞など)は色がかわって表示されるのでわかりやすく、north(北)、east(東)、west(西)、south(南)を知っておけばほぼ問題ありません。
メインクエストとサブクエストがあり、メインクエストはストーリーが進み、サブクエストは経験値やアイテムなどの報酬が手に入れられます。
また、ところどころにネタが散りばめられているようです。"たまたま"そのような名前になったかは定かではありませんが。

アーケードモードは戦ってフロアを進み、スコアを稼いで最初の町を発展させていくモードです。クリアまでのタイム、被ダメージなどによりスコアがかわります。

これからのアップデートに期待できる、とてもよいと思えるゲームです。

17143611.review:
El juego es increible, de lo mejorcito en Early Access ahora mismo y de lo mejorcito indie en general.

Lo Buenísimo:
Es que cuenta con un grandísimo soporte para la comunidad y los modders, en los foros del juego podéis encontrar las herrramientas para traducir el juego directamente, de hecho la traducción al español va por el 90%. Además tienen pensado hacer compatible el juego con Steam Workshop para agilizar el implantar este tipo de modificaciones (aunque realmente es copiar y pegar una carpeta).

Lo bueno: 
Es un juegazo que mezcla con maestría aquellas sensaciones que tuvimos con Secrets of Mana o Zelda de SNES.
-La historia es absolútamente genial.
-Tiene un acabado espectacular, unos arts curradísimos.
-La música no es la mejor pero es agradable de escuchar y va en consonancia con la aventura, es bastante correcta.
-La variedad de cosas que puedes hacer tanto dentro del juego como en el desarrollo de tu personaje.
-Tiene multijugador por ip directa y a través de Steam
-Sistema de logros y varias dificultades.
-A pesar de ser una Beta el proyecto avanza por lo menos y ya lleva detrás de sí un buen puñado de parches lo que quiere decir que hay gente trabajando en el constantemente.
-Tiene un modo arcade divertidísimo.

Lo malo:
-Me gustaría que hubiese más agilidad en cuanto al control del personaje, que se pudiera saltar o que la ubicación del personaje en el mapa fuera más precisa, a veces estoy defendiendo con un escudo o atacando en la dirección que no es porque solo puedo mirar a 4 posiciones.
-El juego crashea en ciertas ocasiones pero eso es cosa de que está en Beta, además en cuanto sucede un error lo puedes reportar directamente.
-Los sprites de los personajes humanos podrían estar un poquito mejor pulidos a veces desentonan con el resto del mapeado.
-Estaría genial que el multijugador contase con servidores propios para agilizar más el cooperativo, porsupuesto si pusieran pvp sería la bomba.
-De momento no tiene cooperativo local en un mismo ordenador, aunque parece ser que lo implementarán en un futuro de momento hay una especie de función oculta mediante comandos que te permite jugar local muy rudimentariamente.


Esta es mi opinión, en definitiva me parece un grandísimo juego que merece la pena comprar, muy bien hecho y mejor hecho que estará sin lugar a dudas teniendo en cuenta la comunidad tan profesional que hay detrás.

Nota: 9/10

17141151.review:
TL/DR;

Pros

  - Spiritual successor to older ARPG titles (Secret of Mana/Star Tropics/A Link to the Past)
  - Solid build customization and choices that change gameplay a lot
  - Responsive Controls, Xbox controller works fine off the hop with zero third party software necessary
  - Good Humor
  - Good Multiplayer Experience and Customization
  - Decent Musical Score
  - Fairly difficult compared to modern games (Tough but fair, it's not quite "Nintendo Hard" but close)

Cons

  - Default keybindings can be hard on hands, probably want a controller unless you want to custom keybind.
  - Menu slightly unintuitive at first
  - Crafting doesn't seem to be covered at all in the first few hours or so
  - Game is incomplete, some areas not accessable even early on, does not impact current gameplay though.




It's pretty decent, only have 3 hours in so far though.

   Like it says on the tin it definitely captures the spirit of Secret of Mana/A Link to the Past/Star Tropics. However it also adds in some nice new shiny features, the biggest one being build customization. I guess the closest comparison on the build system would be something like Skyrim or Kingdoms of Amular: Reckoning (as in non linear, pick whatever you want but there's still progression within each). 

  The controls are responsive however being an old goat I got hand cramps after the first hour and switched to Xbox 360 controller and enjoyed it a lot more after that (could still probably be solved with some manual rebinding). It's a little quirky to get used to the menu controls being that it behaves exactly like an old SNES title (no mouse, nested menus button press down and back up).

  The dialogue is pretty funny, it has a lot of fourth wall humor often poking fun at itself and the genre. So far the score is decent but I'm only a few hours in.

  I got a few friends to buy it and we've been playing together and having a blast, the steam integration makes this super easy. You can choose whether to scale the leveling or not which seems nice but hasn't actually been tested by me yet, we're all pretty low level so I didn't see the point. Also loot options can be customized I didn't bother though as round robin seemed to work, the nice thing is it seems that if you haven't got a chest yet in story mode and another player opens it up you still get it. It doesn't seem to scale the enemies much in 2 player, so you can sort of cheese some content by ressurecting a downed player, but you have to time it properly so I guess it's not the end of the world. Oh and other than that, there's no healing in the game beyond picking up a certain drop (sort of like old Mega-Man games).

 I was nervous buying on early access but feel that this genre was worth the investment, we don't see many and I was pleasently suprised by the quality of this early access and the decent amount of difficulty in the game, you'll probably die quite a bit, but it's pretty fair. So yeah would recommend.

EDIT: After playing with 3 the difficulty does indeed scale, though perhaps not enough I removed the con from the list.
