17129943.review:
I got a little frustrated while exploring when I first got this game, as I discovered the second half of the story mode wasn't completed yet, but this is an early access game with ACTIVE devs who are constantly working on the game to make it the best it can be. The gameplay is very intuitive and fun, and the story is great. You are a collector, and you explore the world looking for cool loot, when you discover that you bag is a living artifact, created long ago, and he's not the only one. In the temples of this game, you must get the artifact at the end, and it seems repetitive, but the game has different ways of getting you into the temple, and (of the two that are in the game currently) each temple has it's own gimmick that makes it stand out from the other(s). 
          If you finish the story as it is now, there is an alternate mode which has more of a Binding of Issac gameplay style as you go through randomly generated floors and fight monsters and attain treasure. But there's a twist; As you progress and earn points through playing Arcade mode, your town upgrades and you can do different things in the town. 
          None of my friends have this game so I haven't gotten to play multiplayer, but if it's as good as single player, I'll love it. 
          Basically, this game has no class restrictions, so you're allowed to grab whatever spells you want, as long as you have skill points, which I absolutely LOVE. This makes chaining spells with your melee attacks incredibly fun and rewarding, but one con I have with this game is that some spells aren't in the game yet.
          Buy this game if you have the patience to wait until ths game reaches its full potential.

17109025.review: If there's a single game in this world that deserves to be recommended, it's without a doubt Secrets of Grindea. It's still a work-in-progress and there's still a crapload of stuff to do and secrets to find! From farming enemies and bosses to sidequests to finding the pet-items that let you recruit new unlockable pets, there's tons of content in the story mode alone! But if that isn't good enough for you, there's the roguelike arcade mode. I'd compare it mostly to Binding of Isaac, going through randomly generated floors and fighting bosses at the end of each one, unlocking bonuses for your next run. What interests me most, though, is that there are rewards that can be transferred to the story mode as well, such as hats or the INSANELY-DIFFICULT-TO-OBTAIN Fae pet. If you're into all that stuff, this game will have you hooked for a LONG, LONG time. Not to mention they're working on a ton of more content as well.

17103894.review:
Let me start off by saying if you think this game doesn't have grinding in it...then seek help. There are people who care about you and don't wish to see you go down this path (not me per se, we've only just met. But I'm sure there are people who love you very much. Like your grandmother or that neighbor with the nice rack. Anyway, I'm going off topic here).

Secrets of Grindea is a tongue-in-cheek RPG that draws heavily on the nostalgia of games like Secrets of Mana, Zelda: Link to the Past, and Illusion of Gaia. The sprite animations and colorful backgrounds mimic classic 16-bit games and go well with the fluidity of combat. NPCs are prevalent in towns and in the overworld to the point where the world does not feel empty and that their character is not some lone warrior living on a planet full of monsters (though that sounds like an awesome game idea. Dibs). Each area has its own unique feel that you will hopefully enjoy because the aforementioned grinding will have you staying in one area killing the same enemies for drops.

The combat is extremely straight forward where your basic attack is spamming one button or having a charged skill where you hold and release one button. Let me go on record to say that I do not think this is a bad thing. Sure, you won't be chaining attacks that culminate in your wooden sword hitting with the power of a tactical nuclear device, but you will be unlocking and upgrading skills that define the way you, the player, wish to play. The skills are limited (for now I hope) to a 1 handed skill set, 2 handed skill set, and a magic skill set. The player is able to mix and match these skills however he or she wants and has the option to refund some or all of the skill points that were spent by spending gold (this is done in the menu rather than with an NPC). There is a bow the player can get from a sidequest but so far doesn't have a dedicated set of skills to leveling up the damage.

The story is pretty straightforward for an RPG of the era it emulates: You are a guy or gal that wakes up, is handing a magical bag that can hold anything without weight restrictions and are sent out to become a renowned member of the "Collectors". It seems, from the start, that these "Collectors" are a bunch of people that go out and collect cool, rare things. It is all very prestigious. And dangerous. And sexy. Seriously, so far every NPC that isn't a Collector is jealous of you. Normally one would have to buy seven sports cars and have an attractive life mate to get that kind of recognition. This game hands that to you right off the bat (Disclaimer: The developers of this game will NOT buy you cars nor introduce you to hot people for a hook up).

My main concern with the game is that it seems too short and I say that knowing full well that not all the features in the game have been implemented; this is not the reason that I feel the game is too short. The in-game journal keeps a record of all the enemies in the game and what they drop when killed. Enemies you haven't killed yet appear in the journal as silhouettes. Upon counting (yes, I did a math) I found that there are only about thirty (30) enemies total in the game including boss enemies. This, in my opinion, is a low number which may make gamers shy away from the game. An increase in not just the number of potential enemies but different types of enemies will add more variety to the grinding while still keeping the player's interest high. I eagerly await the areas that have not yet been implemented to the game.

Now, I'm not going to end this review by giving the game a number based off of 5 nor 10 nor 325745456415 (<--- not sure what this number is. It just punched my Numpad to come up with something ridiculous). I will end this review with just a few simple words:

I enjoy this game.



I hope you enjoy it too.

Still enjoying the game after so long.

17068635.review:
If you are looking for a game to evoke your memories of childhood, this is it.  Secrets of Mana was bar none my favorite game on the SNES.  Nothing I have played since gives quite the same feeling of grinding on rabites for hours on end to build weapon skills.

Not only does Grindea have a similar battle system, but it adds several customization options, from combat skills to magic to costumes, it also adds puzzle elements and arcade modes for further challenge.  The rare loot drops keep you farming mobs and bosses, and for the meta meta minded, there are card drops from in game enemies, in game achievements, Steam achievements, and presumably down the road, Steam cards.  It's a total overload of gathering meta!

If I had to pick some complaints about the game, here they are:

Arcade mode - I'm not patient enough, and never get passed the first or second stage.  Gimme a heal, dammit.

Greenlight - It took way too long to get Greenlight, dammit.

Development time - Stalking the devblog gets old after a while.  It has been way too long a wait for the complete game, dammit.

I might have an issue with patience.

Do yourself a favor, if you ever enjoyed overhead Nintendo games, support the devs, give this a shot.  It's only an amazing themesong and a fuzzy sprite away from being a classic.

Also, hats.  That is all.

17066592.review:
I'm just playing for 2 hours, still I can say it's one of the best game I played in a while.

As the name "Grindea" already implies, the gameplay is kind of grindy, but in a very innovative way. 
Every monster you can find in the world of Grindea has a few possible drops, which can be gathered to craft new equipment or sold to make money and therefore buy new equipment. These drops are listed in some kind of codex but unless you find them, they are blackened out. Besides that there are also very rare cards which drop only once and improves your characters abilities permanently. These two features provide a lot of motivation randomly hunting monsters for their loot while following the main storyline on the side. It's almost a pokemon-like feeling where you try to complete your pokedex.

As I said, I haven't played much, but till now the story is pretty basic stuff. Starting in a small village, doing a test to finally become whatsoever and heading out to great adventures. This is not necessarily a bad point, because you still keep track of the story, even if you skip some dialogues. The dialogues on the other side are quite funny and self-ironic. They make fun of some very stale RPG-cliches, like the bottomless bag of the game's main character.

The main story holds up with some big boss battles, which are more or less challenging, depending on how much you grind on the side. If a boss can drop unique loot, the battle can also be repeated at any time. As far as I discovered, the game also provides some side-activities like fishing or treasure-hunting. 

The game's skill system allow to spend an active skillpoint in melee, magic or supportive and a passive skillpoint in general, melee or magic on each levelup. There are some skills that aren't implemented yet, because the game is still in early access. Nevertheless there are plenty available skills which can be combined freely. Every skill can be charged up to unleash a more powerful attack, which variates based on the amount of skillpoints put into a single skill. All in all the skill-system provides a wide range of different gaming-styles.

Also, there is an arcade mode, where you have only one life to conquer a randomly generated world. Everytime you die, you start all over again in a newly generated world. But there are some unlockable permanent advantages.

Summary: Buy the game! Also I'm sorry for possible language mistakes.

17063923.review:
Шикарная игрушка, прохождение на харде действительно доставляет огромное удовольствие, особенно в компании.

Очень нравится визуальная часть, вроде простая пиксельная графика, но сделано всё с любовью, красивые пейсажи, деревеньками действительно можно любоваться, разработчики очень внимательно отнеслись к деталям.

Неплохой набор скиллов позволяет сделать действительно разных персонажей, ведь очков даётся мало, качать всего по чуть-чуть смысла нет, приходится выбирать, что нужнее.
Сам выбрал двуручное оружие основным. По началу, было крайне просто, скорости атаки и радиуса вполне хватало, чтобы мобы банально не могли подойти ко мне, но чем дальше, тем действительно сложнее, враги становятся быстрее и агрессивнее, и более 1-2 атак за раз по ним уже не сделаешь, загасят в ответ.
Друг выбрал мага суммонера с парой боевых заклинаний, так и проходим.

Кабаны, да, тут есть кабаны! Полюбил этих мобов ещё со времён 3 готики, когда игроки ухахатывались над темой, что последним боссом должен быть огромный хряк.

Боссы это отдельная тема, на каждого нужна своя тактика, наскоком разве что 1-ый убивается, но и там вряд ли кто-то осилит с 1 раза.

Чуть не забыл, а ещё тут есть режим рогалика, в который тоже можно играть в кооперативе, обязательно займёмся им. когда завершим историю, которую разрабочики ещё обещают доделывать и расширять.

В общем, рекомендую.

17063865.review:
Fun game for what there is at the moment. Though there isn't much content in the story mode which i find strange because this game has been in development for years now and they have only managed to finish two temples and a few zones (then they have the cheek of asking for money to go towards coffee breaks in the form of day one DLC) it's still a great bit of fun and the arcade mode adds a lot of replayability. I can't say i'm a fan of the fact they have placed in a online leaderboards as to me that encourages cheating and there's no way you're going to get the #1 spot unless you too cheat and then it makes it seem pointless to do if you're wanting to take part in the arcade mode for the competitive purpose of beating other players. Though this is and the current lack of content in the story mode (at the time of this build i'm sure this will change in later versions) are my only complaints about the game.

The music and sound effects are spot on and you can tell they have heavy inspiration from older RPG games and has a great nostalgic feel about it. I played through the game co-op with one friend and i have to say the net code is spot on and we had no problems with lag what so ever and the game seemed input perfect along with not being too restricted to where you can go in co-op. You and your allies still all have to commit to going to a new zone before the game takes you all there but you're not bound together when you're in that zone. The gameplay is flawless in design too and you feel like you have all the control over your character and when you fuck up and die it is YOUR fault and not the game's. The game has the perfect balance of fun and challenge and the spells/abilities all seem to have their uses though some seem a lot weaker early game and some also seem a lot weaker later game so it's worth experimenting with the abilities as some may be more usefull early game but end up being weak towards the end.

Highly recommend checking this gem out as it lives up to the hype and i am extremely excited in seeing what they add in future updates.

17062379.review:
Что я могу сказать об этой игре? На самом деле многое, но расскажу о самом главном.
1)Разработчик (Pixel Ferrets) потратил огромное кол-во времени, чтобы сделать не просто игру, а нечто большее.
2)Стиль и рисовка игры не могут не порадовать. Каждая локация не такая как другие: своя атмосфера, построение уровня.
3)Интенсивный геймплей: мобы и боссы не дают расслабиться игру ни на секунду, в особенности на повышенной сложности.
4)Хороший саундтрек и проработанные звуки.
5)Реиграбельность: обилие прокачиваемых навыков позволяет пройти игру по разному. Также есть аркадный режим, тоже проработанный и интересный.
6)Интересная система боя основанная на механике скилов.

К сожаления опробывать мультиплеер мне не удалось, но он одназначно веселый и увлекательный.

Огромное спасибо разработчику за блог, где каждый мог понаблюдать за развитием игры и понять, что этот проект будет доведен до ума.

Моя оценка: 10/10. Вердикт: брать однозачно, ведь цена позволяет.

Secrets of Grindea is an awesome little game with a great art style and a lot of care put into it. Has a well written story which is playable entirely in co op (a HUGE plus, more games need to do this) and old school, SNES style action rpg gameplay. 

The writing is funny, the world is enjoyable to explore and beautifully crafted, the gameplay is simple but really fun and challenging at times. If you're looking for a  cool co op game, this is it. If you're looking for a cool game in general, this is also it. 

One slight downside: I recommend playing this with a controller, since keyboard controls are a bit iffy. 

Support games like these!

17049577.review:
[h1][b]Um dos melhores jogos de RPG de Ação atualmente. Repleto de variedade e diversão garantida neste jogo que vai trazer nostalgia à jogos do gênero.[/b][/h1]


[b]O QUE É SECRETS OF GRINDEA?[/b]

Está em busca de um RPG novo mas a falta de títulos para o gênero é grande. Secrets of Grindea é inspirado e traz tanto quanto homenagem e paródias à clássicos [i]Secrets of Mana[/i], [i]Legend of Zelda[/i], [i]Final Fantasy[/i] e até mesmo [i]Ragnarok[/i]. O visual pixelado e o multiplayer são os fatores mais chamativos. O jogo está sendo desenvolvido à mais de 1 ano mas foi chegar ao Steam apenas agora em ainda Acesso Antecipado mas cheio de funcionalidades e com ainda mais para serem adicionadas. Não vá pensando que este é apenas mais um RPG de ação com seu modo história e fim! Grindea vai muito mais além. 

[b]GRÁFICOS[/b]
Visual e arte pixelado trabalhado cuidadosamente para trazer brilho aos olhos. Os cenários são diversificados e repletos de objetos e cores deixando inveja à jogos de empresas grandes.
O toque de inspiração em Ragnarok e aos clássicos do SNES você pode encontrar facilmente, mas nada para se chamar de cópia.

[b]HISTÓRIA[/b]
Na história você é um jovem herói/heroína que tem como missão em se tornar um colecionador famoso. Uma história simples, com bom desenvolvimento durante o jogo e com bastante missões para se fazer. Atualmente o jogo pode ser facilmente finalizado em menos de 10 horas.

[b]JOGABILIDADE[/b]
Um ótimo modo história, mas não é só por ai. A quantidade de diversão em que Grindea pode te trazer é gigante, indo desde jogar em multiplayer em até 4 pessoas com outros modos de jogos bastante divertido.
O jogo possui sistema de nível e experiência que junto tem diversas habilidades para serem escolhidas. Opções é o que não falta, te trazendo tudo detalhadamente com informações sobre itens e até re-configuração de teclas, deixando a escolha da pessoa em jogar da maneira que quiser tanto no teclado ou controle.
Como o foco do jogo é colecionar, a garantia de quantidade de itens, armas e chápeus é o que não vai faltar.

[b]TRILHA SONORA[/b]
Músicas lindas que se encaixam perfeitamente à cada àrea do jogo.

[b]CONTRIBUIÇÃO AO GÊNERO[/b]
Secrets of Grindea é um tanto para quem já jogou clássicos já citados acima ou para quem nem nunca jogou um RPG de ação, pois é viciante e consegue te trazer diversão por diversas horas sem enjoar em nenhum momento.
A garantia que ele não decepciona é a repleta variedade em que o jogo traz.

17045651.review:
Secrets of Grindea is an action RPG that hones many aspects from RPGs that I know and love. I will be going into a lot of detail about the game and why I love it so much, so hold on to your seats!

Gameplay

The game has a story mode and an Arcade Mode. The story mode is currently unfinished (along with the Arcade Mode), but the game currently boasts a lot of sidequests and collectables along with the story. I have managed to collect almost all of the cards (the rarest collectables in the game, one unique to all normal enemies) as of the 15th of July and I continue to collect even more in the future when I have the time and patience to do so! The game features many sidequests, puzzles and hidden items to find and collect, which required thinking and pure potential in your combatting skills. Currently, the game is very difficult in its Arcade Mode and Hard Mode of the story. 

Arcade Mode is the true challenge of the game and the main feature that people will come back to after beating the story. Similar to many roguelike indie games such as The Binding of Isaac and many more titles, the game offers a mode that offers permanent death and restarting all over again upon death, which will truly test your skills. Many of the enemies are buffed up versions of monsters seen in the later parts of the story, beefed up bosses from the story mode and some completely unique enemies that are not (yet) available in the story mode. For anybody who likes roguelike games, this is for you! This also is a good option to play the game without the story being spoiled for yourself if you would like to play the story from the beginning until the end with no interuptions!

For you bustling people with many friends, both modes offer multiplayer aspects, but more people doesn't come with no risk. More players often means newer moves (at least in the story mode) and higher enemy HP, that truly will test your skill instead of making the game a breeze. 

Soundtrack

The soundtrack of the game isn't extremely special, but the music fits the game very well and really creates the mood of the game. Often faster-paced/more upbeat versions of the songs in the story mode are used in Arcade Mode corresponding to the area that they are found in. The music is definitely highly atmospheric and I definitely reccomend the soundtrack for any outer-game listening purposes!

Design/Artwork

The art of the game is very detailed and is drawn to a great extent. All of the places in the game are drawn in photoshop and in good detail. Sprites and other things are done seperately but the game blends in and really feels alive. Many of the animations used in the game are done very well and the artwork to follow the characters are also done to perfection. The game is crisp and looks good all the time!

Overall Rating

I think this game is possibly my favourite game I've played in a very very long time, and the game isn't even finished yet. I would definitely reccomend this game to anybody who wants a good game!

Rating:
9.5/10

+ Great Visuals and Animations
+ Replayability is done very well
+ Challenging compelling gameplay
+ Completionists Lucid Dream

- Some game artwork scaled down and doesn't look as good as the original
- The game isn't out yet, not the full experience yet.

If you would like to form your own opinion, there is also a Demo. If you would like to support the developers more, you can get some higher tiers that unlock some extra rewards for your purchase, including helping development ideas and even your own NPC in the game!

17034828.review:
I have over 100 hours pumped into the game [if you include the pre-steam access] and this is one of my favorite games of all time.

Pros:
- Typical story, but hilarious dialog, fun characters and environmental/discovery-based story telling makes it a great experience.
- Super deep and rewarding combat system with a plethora of skills and mechanics to master such as the perfect guard.
- Enemies and bosses attack differently between normal and hard mode, as well as single or multiplayer
- Skill charging makes it so you have almost 3 different skills at your disposal despite leveling only one skill.
- Loads of side quests, mini games and discoveries to be found.
- Multiplayer with up to 4 players that is super smooth gameplay-wise. Connection is also easy via Steam friend list.
- Gorgeous pixel art that contains many little details to make the game world feel alive.
- Music fits each area very well and does not overstay its welcome at all.
- Arcade (roguelite) mode adds a ton of replayability. Beating it is hard enough, the side roguelite quests and high score chasing allows infinite replayability.

Cons:
- Non-hosts may experience lag, which ruins the multiplayer experience [case-by-case basis]
- Would be nice for some skills to interact with each other more for multiplayer mayhem [Earth spike wall + Smash?]

For a detailed full impressions video [8 minutes long], check out this video below!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IE9YK0uO0nY

17031982.review:
Secrets of Grindea is an ARPG inspired by old classics such as The Legend of Zelda, Secret of Mana etc.

You play as a Collector (or a Collector to be) in the world of grindea, a world where everyone is obsessed with collecting items and despite the word "Grind" in the title, you never feel like you HAVE to grind, its always there as a side task to help you get some rare loot etc.

It also features a very customisable skill system where you can effectively build a character you want, there are no unique classes as such and all the skills you see are the skills you will get, each skill has its benefits and drawbacks.

The Game is split into 2 different modes, Story mode and Arcade mode, Story mode is exactly what you expect from most RPG's and Arcade mode is very Roguelike where each death is a learning experience (and trust me, you'll die A LOT)

The Soundtrack is Amazing, i regret not purchasing it myself, it fits the game so perfectly.

17031245.review:
Charming, fun, vibrant and addicting - this is one great RPG!

In this world you are a Collector, someone who explores and adventures across the world in search of rare loot and items of power! Every enemy in the game has at least one rare "drop" to collect so this really is a game for players who love to collect/farm/grind! There is also a crafting system that can *GASP* actually make powerful and useful gear!

The combat gives off vibes of Secret of Mana but its much less rigid and limited than the old school RPGs of yore are. You can choose freely amongst 1h melee with shield, 2h melee and 4 schools of magic (Fire, Earth, Ice and Air). You invest skill points into whatever skill you desire and then the combat becomes an awesome weave of offense and defense as you bust out your skills in real-time!

Boss battles are great and plentiful as well! Really, this is a great action oriented RPG with a major emphasis on its addicting collection system (GRINDea, get it? :P) Usually "grinding" is looked poorly upon but honestly its quite addicting in this game and every enemy and boss can be beaten without taking a single point of damage so ultimately you don't actually have to grind - if you're really good!

17030046.review:
To review this game is to review it in two parts.

[b]Story Mode[/b]: An amazing adventure akin to the days of Secret of Mana, Sword of Mana and Seiken Densetsu 3. Quick swordplay with an oldschool-meets-polish aesthetic that's filled with charm. Combat is quick paced and - with over 20 skills and spells with multiple charge levels, along with 30 talents - more or less unique for every character made. Every attack, skill and spell feels as if it has weight behind it for a thoroughly satisfying brawl through hordes of monsters and challenging bosses.

The story is serious at times, tongue in cheek in others without outright resorting to cheese. There's plenty of side-quests, mini-games and collectables, but contrary to the name no grinding appears to be necessary. The shield is as relevant to the gameplay as the sword is, every attack can be blocked if you know the exact timing, reminding me of the days of 'Timed Hits' from Super Mario RPG and Final Fantasy 8.

The music is beautiful, the characters well written to make you love or hate them, I can't say enough good things about Story Mode. The only shame is it's incomplete, but between pet taming, treasure hunting, fishing, card collecting, playing with 4 player online co-op and duking it out in the arena, there's more than enough content to keep me busy between updates.

[b]Arcade Mode[/b]: All the rules from Story Mode no longer apply, Arcade Mode feels like an entirely different game. Less Secret of Mana, more Binding of Isaac. You start in an empty plain and delve within a randomized roguelike-esque labyrinth. Each room is different every time, filled with traps and all manners of enemies or bosses not present in Story Mode. HP is precious, mastery of skills, spells and shielding is required.

Arcade Mode is perfect for sinking endless hours into as you try to go deeper and deeper into the labyrinth, gaining points and essence to level up and expand your town, unlock new NPCs to aid you, take on quests for rare and unique loot not found anywhere else. Skills and spells are best experimented with in here to see which build suits you best. With friends it's harder, but with 4 people on screen the monsters barely stand a chance once you hit your groove. The online leaderboards for Arcade Mode help to give it even more replay value by trying to do better than your friends or complete strangers to try and hit #1.

If you have any doubts whatsoever, try the demo. With an hour of Story Mode gameplay, several hours of Arcade Mode and co-op bundled into the demo, it's a great teaser for what to expect moving forward.

[b]Tip[/b]: Opt into 'Frontline' by selecting SoG in your library if you want quicker updates. The normal version receives slower updates, but your experience in the game will be much smoother.
